1.content:
It was the sounds of a city coming to life and the bright sunlight piercing his bedroom window that woke Evan up. The lion stretch out while lying on the mattress of his absurdly large bed. So wide was it, in fact, that he could easily stretch out his arms and reach neither side. It was far bigger than he needed. Yet he didn't buy it. It was one of the features of apartments in places like Port Zaftig, Evan came to learn.

"That's just part of the culture here at Port Zaftig," said Simone when she was on the phone with Evan some weeks ago. She was one of the building managers and wanted to go over a few things about the rental agreement with Evan before he made the big move. "You know how when most furs move, they'll just leave the plunger for the next residents? The same kinda goes here. The last tenet didn't want to have to pack up a bunch of his furniture, so he just left it for the next fur to have. Lucky you!"

Lucky Evan, indeed. He had limited space in his car and there was no way he would be able to bring anything like a bed or couch or television or dresser with him. But he hit the jackpot, apparently. Not only did the last tenet practically left the apartment fully furnished, but the bed and the couch were absolutely massive. Hell, Evan figured that the couch alone was bigger than his old bed.

The lion scratched the cream-color fur of his flat abdomen as he yawned. He had woken up from a long nap and now it was late in the morning. However, Evan had only been in Port Zaftig for a few hours. Dawn was breaking as his drove over the final hill on his route. Rays of golden light shined off many of the city's tall skyscrapers. Rather than spending one more night at a dingy motel, Evan decided instead to drive through the night on the last leg of his journey. It had taken him nearly four days to get from his small hometown of Bastion to the city of Port Zaftig and the lion was so eager to get there that he was willing to stay up the entire night if it meant one less day on the road.

It didn't take him long to find his new apartment building located at the edge of town. Being so early in the morning, there was a parking spot for him in front of the building. He grabbed a couple of duffel bags full of clothes and approached the door. Out of a manila envelop, he pulled out a key card, a mail box key, and the key to his apartment.

"Typically, I'm there to see new tenets to their place," Simone explained over the phone. "But none of the building managers will be there that day, so I'm sending everything you need so you can see yourself in."

A small black box was mounted on the wall next to the absurdly wide front doors. He swiped the key card in front of the box, and the light on it turned from red to green. A metallic clunking noise let Evan know the door was unlocked. He opened it up and walked through the warm and bright lobby. Nobody was around. The door to the elevator were equally as comically wide as the front door. When it arrived, Evan stepped inside and noticed the sheer size of the lift. It reminded him of a cargo elevator at one of his past jobs.

"Maximum weight: 12,000 pounds" a shiny placard on the button panel read. Evan chuckled as he pressed the 7 button. His apartment was number 703.

The hallway on the seventh floor was equally as wide as the doors. The lion could have easily driven a car down these hallways. He noticed that there weren't many other rooms on the floor. Maybe, he guessed, there were seven other apartments on the floor. This was far fewer than he expected, but when he opened the door to apartment 703, he saw why. Despite the cheap rent, the apartment was incredibly massive with a huge living room, a spacious kitchen, a vast bedroom, and a bathroom equipped with the largest shower stall the lion every saw in his life.

Half a dozen trips to his car later and it was entirely unloaded. Various boxes and bags laid about the living room. Evan was in no rush to unpack everything, though. It was still very early in the morning and he was working on no sleep whatsoever. So he pulled off his clothes and jumped into bed.

Now it was a few hours later and Evan had just hopped out of the shower. He laughed when he first got in there. The stall was several times bigger than he was and wondered why any fur would need such a large shower to begin with. He padded his gold and cream colored fur dry and dug a fresh pair of jeans and shirt out of one of this duffel bags. Well, as fresh as they could be considering they've been in that bag for four days now.

Today marked Evan's first day in Port Zaftig.

As the lion stared out the window, he pondered what he should do with the day. Port Zaftig was known for its clean beaches and bright oceans. Evan spent all of his life in a tiny town in a landlocked state. The lion had never even seen the ocean and considered spending a day at the coast.

Evan's stomach gurgling in protest. He placed a paw on it to sooth his empty belly. He realized that he hadn't eaten much in the last day. And while he packed some food with him, most of it was snacks to munch on while traveling. The lion realized that he should probably find a bite to eat nearby, or maybe take a trip to the grocery store.

He had saved up enough money to live in Port Zaftig for a few months without any financial problems. That being said, he'll eventually need to find work. The sooner, the better. So Evan thought it might be productive to hunt for a job.

But then again, the past few days doing nothing but driving. The nap was refreshing, but still felt a bit exhausted. Perhaps the day would be better spent relaxing at home, maybe doing some unpacking, but in general taking it easy.

Or, he thought, he should be a good neighbor and introduce himself to the other furs on the floor, at least the ones on the left and right of his apartment. Hopefully, they haven't left for work yet or anything.
1.title: Day One at Port Zaftig

choices: Take a dip in the ocean
11.content:
It was not the white Sandy beaches or the deep blue ocean waves that Evan saw when he pulled into a parking lot next to the coast. What he first saw was an enormous snow leopard waddle. A quarter ton of lard wobbled and jiggled as the fur slowly plodded along, fat oozing out from underneath his tight swim trunks. Evan had to take a moment and gawk at the fur. Never before in his life had he see a fur so massively obese, so incredibly fat. The lion even saw, as the fur was waddling away, that his tail too was somehow fat as well looking like a long, plump sausage hanging lazily over the snow leopard's mammoth rump.

As Evan walked along the beach, however, he learned that the snow leopard fit right in. Many of the furs he witnessed were at some stage of obesity. Even furs that had hulking biceps and pecs still sported enormous guts. The lion, it appeared, was the odd one out as he made his was up the beach in his swimming shorts, a white towel hanging over a bare shoulder. Most of the northern parts of the beach we're sectioned off for tourists; resorts privatized those pars of the coasts for their customers. Only when Evan approached these parts of the coast did he begin to see furs his size again.

It took a moment for the initial shock of seeing so many furs so grossly overweight to wear off. But Evan's thoughts returned to the beach. This was the first time in his life he had ever been. Because his hometown was right in the center of the country, any trips to the coast would have taken several days just to travel there. So growing up, Evan's folks couldn't take him or his siblings to see the ocean.

But that was then. Evan finally got to see the ocean!

The lion was overwhelmed with possibilities about what to do. Obviously, he wanted to take a dip in the ocean. The water was mostly empty sans a few heavy furs lazily paddling around. The lion could laid down his towel and do a bit of sunbathing. Evan always liked the slightly darker hue his gold and cream fur would take on with enough sunrays.

While walking along the coast, Evan did spot a nice ice cream shop built right up to the sands. It was getting to get really warm, and a cone did sound good at the moment.

Evan didn't know anyone in town. Of course, it was his first day in the city. But it's never too soon to start making acquaintances. He might want to strike up a conversation with one of the locals.
11.title: Beach trip

111.content:
Now Evan was in a bit of trouble.

The lion had never been in the ocean before. He had never been able to swim around in such a large body of water. Growing up, the lion loved swimming. But the only place he could swim in back in Bastion was in one of his friend's small backyard swimming pools. But Evan now lived in a city where he was a short drive away from being able to swim to his heart's content.

And that was exactly what he did for the past few hours. The coast was particularly empty. Many of the obese furs preferred parking their gigantic rears in the sand and letting the waves splash over them. Evan wasn't complaining. This gave him plenty of space to swim laps up and down the length of the coast without interruption.

However, the lion didn't realize that as he was swimming the tide was going back out. Little by little, the lion was drifting away from the beach. It was only when the exhaustion hit him from hours of such physical activity that made him stop and take into account his surroundings. He was floating pretty far away from the coast. The large furs that littered the shore were only specks in the horizon. This greatly worried Evan. The lion was so exhausted that he didn't think he could swim all the way back to the coast or that anyone would hear him yell for help.

The lion began to panic. As he floated, he felt himself being pulled further into the ocean. If he didn't think of something and quick, he'd be lost at sea.

Then, not too far off in the distance, a spray of water shot into the air. Evan saw as a shiny, smooth dark grey head pop out of the water, take a deep breath, and dive down under the water again. A thick dark and light grey tail rose out from the water and slapped the waves on the way back down.

"Hey! Hey!" Evan yelled as he saw the head pop up again. The fur heard the lion and saw him floating in the ocean. "I need help!"

The aquatic fur stuck his head underwater again and gracefully swam his way over to Evan. A dorsal fin cut through the waves like a hot knife through butter. As the creature got closer, Evan could make out the sheer enormity of the fur through the clear waters.

The shiny head popped up out of the water again. "You need help with something?" the dolphin asked.

"Yeah, I've been swimming for a few hours and didn't realize how far I drifted out and now I'm-"

"Need a ride back to the shore?" the dolphin cut in. "No worries. It happens every once in a while. Here, grab on!" He turned his back to Evan indicating for the lion to grab onto the dorsal fin. The moment Evan latched on, the dolphin took off for the beach.

Hanging on as tight as he could, Evan occasionally bumped against the dolphin's blubbery flank. The sensation reminded of when he was a cub visiting his aunt's house. She had an enormous water bed that Evan loved bouncing on and playing with. Colliding with the dolphin felt almost the exact same way.

It only took minutes before they were close enough to the shore that the lion could feel sand under his feet again. He let go of the fin and walked up to the beach, shaking off the water from his fur.

The dolphin steppes out of the water. The sun shined off of his rubbery grey skin. A bit taller than Evan, the dolphin had a few hundred pounds over the lion. His abdomen was encases by two enormous tires of blubber that reached nearly all the way around his back and formed sizable love handles. His pecs were two thick slabs of lard with black nipples the size of silver dollars. The skin on his belly and chest was much lighter shade of gray than the darker skin that covered the rest of him. His legs and rear were heavily muscled no doubt thanks to swimming, but nevertheless were covered in a considerable amount of fat as well. Even the dolphin's tail looked laden with lard. The fur was wearing small black swim trunks that looked like a sausage case on his obese frame with a hole in the black for his tail which was being stretched to its absolute limit.

"Oh man, thank you! You're a lifesaver!" the lion said to the dolphin.

"Like I said, it's no big deal. I usually have to fish tourists like you out of the ocean once or twice a month." the dolphin replied.

"Oh, I'm not a tourist," Evan replied. "I live here!"

"Ah, you don't exactly look the part," the dolphin said under his breath.

"I don't what now?"

"Nevermind. My name is Keith, by the way!"

The two shook. "And I'm Evan!"

"Nice to meet you! You like swimming? A few other furs and I meet one a week to take a nighttime dip in the sea. Absolutely nothing beats a sweltering hot day like a swim in some icy cold water. Care to join? We're meeting up tomorrow night."
111.title: Castaway

112.content:
Evan laid on the warm sands, peacefully resting as the bright sun shined on his body. The combination of the heat and the few hours of sleep he had left him tired. The lion was just about to drift off to sleep when he noticed through his closed eyes that something was eclipsing the sun. Yet the moment Evan opened his eyes, a cloud of sand hit his face. Bellowing laughter was be heard as he brushed the sand from his face.

When the lion could see again, he saw the culprit. Standing in front of him was an obese fox. Probably six feet tall and pushing past four hundred pounds, a red furry globe of a gut jutted out from the fox's midsection and hung far below the waistline of his swim suit, and two melon-like sacks of pudge rested on top of the mound. The fox's arms and legs were padded out with soft lard, and his face was accompanied by a thick second chin and puffed up cheeks which nearly closed up his eyes as he laughed.

"What the hell, man?" yelled Evan as he got up from the ground.

"Beach's for locals only!" the fox yelled back as he stiffed his laughter.

"Stupid idiot! I live here!"

The fox stopped laughing and eyed Evan up and down. The lion hopped this wouldn't end in a fight; that fox had the clear height and weight advantage. "Bullshit. Go back to your fancy resort beaches. If I see your skinny ass around these parts again, I'll pound you into the sand!" The fox turned around to walk away. Evan noticed the strain his heavy rump was making on the back of his trunks.

Furious, Evans stewed in his anger. What made that fox think he can bully people around, regardless of if they're a local or not? As he watched the fox waddle away, plans formed in his head for revenge.

However, Evan just got to this city and it was pretty early to start making enemies. It sounded like the fox had legitimate grievances against the tourists who flock to Port Zaftig. Maybe if he talked to the fox, he'll find out what made him so upset in the first place.

Or perhaps Evan ought to just let this whole thing go. Sure, the guy was a jerk. But there was no need to escalate the matter.
112.title: Beach bully

1121.content:
"Those don't look like they belong to you..."

Evan had followed the rotund red fox as he slowly waddled his way across the beach. He had stopped to collect his belongings before heading over to one of the concrete building dotted along the coast where furs could shower off and change out of their swim suits. The lion watched from a safe distance as the fox entered one such structure. Inside, Evan peaked around a corner to see the fox showering his flabby body. The two cellulite-covered spheres that made up his butt were bare as his swim suit hung up on a hook nearby. The lion deftly snuck over and snagged the trunks off the hook. No other fur was inside nor did he think the red fox was aware of him, so Evan felt like he was going to get off scot free.

That is, until the quarter ton snow leopard he saw earlier was blocking the only way out.

"I said, those don't look like they belong to you..." the obese snow leopard said pointing to the tent-like trunks in Evan's paws.

"Well, they are...I mean... it's just that..." Evan stammered.

The snow leopard placed a pudgy paw on Evan's shoulder and pulled him into his marshmallowy body. "Let's go find out who those belong to, then!"

The fat cat dragged Evan back into the showers. Evan struggled as he tried to pull himself away. But the snow leopard definitely had the weight advantage and all the lion could do was helplessly get pulled along as his slender body melded into the leopard's lardy frame.

"Hey, Lucas! Are these yours?" The snow leopard yanked the trunks away from Evan who was still be held tightly against him. The red fox shut off the water and waddled over nude to the two furs, his belly hanging low enough to cover his privates. "This tourist seemed to have found them..."

"Oh, did he now..." asked the red fox as he glared at Evan. "Wait a minute, I remember you! You aren't going to believe this, Toby, but this skinny runt says that he's a local!"

The snow leopard let out a laugh. "This twig?" He pulled Evan in closer as the lion's face burrowed deeper into the fat cat's moob.

"I just moved here!" Evan said shoving his face out of the snow leopard's flab who then released Evan, pushing him off towards a corner of the shower. He gasped and reeled as he picked himself up off the tiled floor. The red fox and snow leopard waddled towards him as the lion backed himself into a corner. Both furs, easily a half ton total, smirked as they slowly approached Evan.

"Yep! A newbie!" said the red fox as his belly pressed into Evan, pinning him against the shower walls.

The snow leopard soon joined in, his own gigantic gut joining in to force the slim lion against the walls. "Huh, maybe we can show him a good time. Kitty looks pretty hungry." He pressed himself up against Evan harder who gasped and squirmed. "What do you say, Kitty? Feeling hungry? Let us treat you to something, a welcoming gift..."

11212.content:
The walls of the shower were still wet enough for Evan to slip down them on his back. The two fat furs pressing their guts into him were caught off guard and lurched forward. Evan tried quickly slipping between the legs of one of the furs, the naked red fox, shimming along the floor to get free. But before he could get clear, he saw the mass of wobbling red fur come crashing down on him. The lion had the wind knocked out of him as nearly a quarter ton of pudge came crashing down on his chest. Evan struggled to breathe, his body from the shoulders up were surrounded by the fox's flabby thighs and belly. What little air he could take in was tainted by the smell of the obese fox's groin. He struggled to push the fox off of him. But the lion was only a fraction of his weight so the fox wouldn't budge. Evan heard the two furs laughing, their noise muffled by the layers of fat that were resting over his head.

Evan felt like he was about to suffocate. Just when he thought he was about to pass out, the red fox was pulled off of the lion in a violent manner. Gasping, Evan saw as another fur, a bulky, muscular horse, throw the red fox across the shower. The fox's body jiggled as he landed hard on the ground. He turned to see the snow leopard running as best as his fat body could out of the showers, a panicked look was on his face. The red fox picked himself off the ground. Evan heard a loud slap then a yelp from the fox. The lion, still trying to catch his breath, saw as the fox waddled fast out of the showers, clutching his swim trunks in his paws as his bare rump jostled and shook with each step.

"You okay?" asked the horse as he picked Evan off of shower floor.

"Yeah, yeah, I think I'm alright." The lion took in the horse who had saved him. The fur was tall, easily close to seven feet, with light brown fur and a dark muzzle, a shaggy mane of blonde hair and a long black tail. The horse was wearing blue shorts that looked painted on to his thick, well-defined quads and glutes. His arms were equally as swollen. It was no wonder he was able to pull off the fat fox with the massive biceps he was sporting. The horse's chest was like two slabs of solid muscle. The only part of the fur that wasn't beefed up was his stomach which domed out into a firm ball gut.

"Why were those guys attacking you?" the horse asked Evan.

"I dunno. That fox started giving me crap about being a tourist or something."

"Damn, it's furs like that that give our city a bad name to visiting folks."

"But that's the thing though, I live here now! I literally just moved in today!"

The horse looked up and down Evan's body. "Really, huh? Well, no offense, but you might want to bulk up a little bit. This city is filled with furs as big as those clowns, and plenty of furs will use their weight against you if they see they're several times bigger than you."

"Really? I mean, I guess I could stand to put on some muscle..." The lion rubbed a paw along his flat chest. "My hometown was pretty small, so they're weren't any gyms or anything. So I never got the chance to put on any weight or anything."

"Well, Dorthy, you aren't in Kansas anymore!" joked the horse. "And you're in luck because there just happened to be someone you know who can help you out with that..." He flexed his arm, making his already huge bicep swell up.

"You...what?"

"I'm a personal trainer! Have been for years"

"Oh, uh, that's nice. But I don't think I can afford a personal trainer right now. I don't have a job and all of my savings are going to rent and stuff."

"That's a shame. Well...actually..." The horse looked at Evan's body, inspecting it all over. "You know, I don't get too many clients like you. Skinny, I mean. Really skinny. So I don't get much of an opportunity to really show off what I do. I think there's a deal we can reach."

"What did you have in mind?"

"Here's what I'm thinking. I'll be your personal trainer for free, help you bulk up and hit the gym. And in exchange, I get to document your change. Photos, and the like. All I ask is you let me use that stuff to build up a kind of 'portfolio' that I can use to show other furs the serious work I can do. If I can beef you up, I'd never be out of work again! Heck, I can even throw some cash your way too!"

"So, you want me to be some kind of before-and-after model like you see on those cheesy infomercials?" ask the lion.

"Before, after, and during. Look, it'll give me a chance to prove to other furs what I can do. Like I said, if I can turn a skinny guy like you into a meat mountain, I'll always have furs pounding on my door looking for help!"

The lion chuckled. "I don't know if I want to be a 'meat mountain'...but okay. I think we have a deal." The lion stuck out a paw, and the horse shook it.

"The name's Levi Werbeck! Glad to be working with you! Now, how would you like to begin? We could hit the weights hard. Though that might not be best for you since it doesn't look like you work out that much. But we can do that if you want to. Or, we could work on your nutrition. What you put into your body is almost as important as what you do in the gym!"

click click click click

Levi snapped several photos as Evan, wearing only a pair of y-front briefs, flexed his arms. Though the lion hadn't been weight lifting for long, he had been making noticeable progress. Biceps were growing, his chest was firming up with muscle, his quads were thickening up, and his gluts were growing. Alone in the kitchen again, Evan picked up the business card.

MAC SLATER
BUSINESS ANALYTICS CONSULTANT
(901) 237-079

All the extra thousands of calories made their way to Evan's belly. He didn't mind the extra weight that much. Being super skinny all of his life, the lion rather enjoyed the extra bit of pudge. But Jake had sucked down far more calories than his feline friend, eating as if he was carbo loading after a meet, eating as much as one of the large locals, sometimes more.

"It's...not so bad..." Evan said, examining Jake's backside. He was being kind. In reality, one more burger and those trunks might split apart.

The grey lion moaned. "I've got to lose this weight...And this means no more cheat days! You got it? I'm going to have to work my butt off if I'm going to be in competition shape when I'm done with rehab...literally work my butt off..." Jake poked one of his plump butt cheeks. It wobbled only slightly being so constructed by his trunk. He looked Evan directly in the eyes. "No. More. Cheat. Days."

"Okay, okay," Evan said, begging off. "No more cheat days. Don't you still want to go to the beach? I mean, you can swim and burn off some calories?"

"Are you kidding me?" Jake shot back. "I can't let anyone see me like this!"

"What do you mean? You probably won't even be noticed! There are a ton of bigger furs at the beach! Nobody will notice you!"

Jake groaned again, this time biting his lip. "I really don't want to go," he pled. "I'd rather lock myself up here until I drop a few pounds..."
11311.title: Cheat Day(s)

choices: Encourage Jake to diet and exercise again
113111.content:
JUMBO JAKE STRUTS HIS STUFF


Competitive swimming champion Jake McCarthy was spotted on the beaches of Port Zaftig by one of our roving reports and boy has that lion got lardy! Julia Rote snapped a few pics of Jake and the new badonkadonk he sporting! Yikes! Better size up there, Jakey!

Evan glanced to the side of the article where several photos of Jake were. Each photo was accompanied by a stinging caption.

Need a hand? said a caption beside a photo of Jake trying to yank up the trunk that were sliding off his rump.

Lay off the snacks, kitty! was next to a photo of Jake biting into an ice cream sandwich.

Lion to Landwhale! There was a side-by-side comparison of Jake from a swim meet years ago, abs cut and defined, next to a photo taken of him at Port Zaftig, his abs covered by a thick layer of fat.

Evan grimaced as he tossed the tabloid magazine into the coffee table. "Yeesh...well, it's harsh but, you know, words can't hurt, right?"

Jake huffed. Droplets of chocolate ice cream flew out of his mouth. "I've already lost three sponsorships..." The grey lion dug his spoon into the half gallon of ice cream sitting in his lap. "Do you know how hard it is to get Nokies as a sponsor?" He shoveled a massive wad of the frozen treat into his mouth.

A pang of guilt hit Evan in his stomach. "Damn...but, don't you think you're taking it a bit...too hard?" He gestured at the half dozen empty ice cream cartons laying around Jake's living room. They were all full earlier that day. The swimmer sat shirtless on his couch. His gut, a vast furry dome filled to the brim, rested on his lap. The soft layer of fat had swelled out into a hard ball. Evan could just make out to loose boxer shorts from underneath the mass.

Jake said nothing is response. Instead, he tossed the spoon aside and raised the carton to his mouth. The ice cream was liquidy enough for the grey lion to drink the rest. Evan anxiously watched as he drank, worried that the lion's poor belly might just explode. Audible creaks could be heard from Jake's stomach. Finished, Jake threw the carton aside and let out a low belched. A ring of chocolate stained his mouth.

"Fuck it, if they think I'm a landwhale, then I'll be a landwhale..." he groaned. Jake tried getting up off the couch. Yet the weigh of his immense gut made it too difficult and he collapsed back down. "Ugh, do me a favor and grab me another thing of ice cream from the fridge? I don't care about the flavor."

"Dude! Get a hold of yourself!" pled Evan. "You can't do this to yourself! Yeah, this all sucks but you'll slim back down and be back out there nabbing sponsorships again!"

The grey lion just gave Evan a look. "Ice cream, now."
113111.title: Paparazzi

choices: Scout a fat fur for Jake
11312.content:
"...and then I got a few of these huge burritos down at Tito's Taco Tavern, and then ice cream from that place right next door to it! It was so good! Then, I went back for seconds at Tito's..."

"Damn, man...67...68...took rehab in the wrong city...69...70...probably would have turned into a whale...71...72...if I didn't have my willpower..."

Jake was on the floor of his apartment, shirtless, sweaty, and doing sit-ups. His ripped abs glistened. Evan had stopped by to visit and was recounting all the restaurants and eateries he had been to over the last week, which was many. The lion now sported a substantial pot belly which strained his shirt, forcing it to ride up and expose a few inches of flesh. He had stealthly undid the buttons of painfully tight pants when Jake wasn't looking to relieve some of the pressure due to his gut.

"Dude, you need to take another cheat day sometime," Evan said to Jake. "You have no idea what you're missing out on."

The grey lion finished his set and got up off of the floor. Grabbing a chair hanging off the back of a chair, he stared whipping beads of sweat from his brow. "Nah, can't. Gotta make sure I'm at competition wei-" Just then, a loud knock came from the door of Jake's apartment. He wandered over and opened it up. In came a svelte brown female cat dressed in tight yoga pants and a light jacket.

"Miranda! Glad you could stop by!" Jake gave the cat a quick hug as he ushered her into the living room.

"Glad I could stop by! But we have to make this quick. My taxi is waiting outside and if I'm too long I'll miss my connecting flight." From a bag from around her shoulder, she produced a stack of papers and handed them to Jake. "Boilerplate agree, but give it a glance anyways." He took the papers from her and started skimming through them.

Miranda spotted Evan siting on the couch and approached him. "A friend of yours? Hello, I'm Miranda Fitzgerald. I manage Jake over there."

Evan got up to shake her hand. He noticed her eyes briefly darted down to his belly. "Evan. Nice to meet you!"

"Are you a local?"

"Am now. I moved here not long ago."

"I see," she said, her eyes again gazing at his gut. "You certainly are starting to look the part."

"I'm starting to..?"

Jake interrupted them, handing the papers he just signed back to Miranda. "Here, Miranda. Signed, sealed, delivered."

"Wonderful, dear." She packed the papers back into her bag. "Got to go. But remember that idea we talk about a few weeks ago? Maybe talk with you're new friend about it." She gave Jake another quick hug before rushing out the door, slamming it shut behind her.

"Uh, what was that all about?" asked Evan.

"Oh, Miranda had a short layover in town and took that was an opportunity to swing by and have me sign some papers."

"No, I mean the other thing she said. Whatever you two were planning."

Jake nervously rubbed a paw on the back of his neck. "Heh, that. Just a stupid idea. Forget about it."

"Come on! Tell me!" Evan pestered Jake.

"Okay, okay. So, I'm thinking about cutting back on competitions because of my injury and whatever. And I've been thinking about going into the whole 'fitness' industry. Dieting and exercise, more specifically. I mean, I have a killer body!" The grey lion gestured a paw along his well-defined abs. "So I've got to know a thing or two about what it takes to get a hot body. I figured I could come up with a diet plan that furs would die to have. The McCarthy Plan, I'll call it!"

"So, why did Miranda ask you to bring it up with me?" asked Evan.

"Well, you are looking a bit chunky these days." Evan instinctively tugged his shirt back down over the dome of his gut. He could only pull it down another inch. "You might just be the first fur to try The McCarthy Plan! I mean, if I can't find anyone else to."

"Huh?"

"Part of the reason I'm rehabbing in Port Zaftig is to try and find a big fur to slim down and show the companies my plan works. And this place is full of, uh, Miranda called them 'big fat fucks'. She's kinda right. If I can get one of these furs down to a normal BMI, I'll be raking it in! So if you want, you can help me scout around for a fat fur to enlist. Either way, I'm sure Miranda will give you a nice cut of the money."

"Yeah, and I kinda need it..." moaned Evan. "I've practically eaten all my savings already..."
11312.title: The McCarthy Plan

choices: Agree to fatten up for Jake
Try once again to find a fur to slim down
113121.content:
"...and then the next thing I know I'm flat on my back!" Evan said to Jake over the phone. He readjusted the ice pack on his face. "God, that lady had a hell of a right hook."


"Ouch. You doing okay?" Jake asked.

"Yeah, just a bruised ego. And a bruised eye. But seriously, that's the 15th fur I've asked and all I've gotten was either a 'no' or a 'hell no'. I don't think you'll find anyone here who'll take you up on the diet thing."

Jake sighed audibly into the phone. "Alright. Well, I have a back-up plan. Swing by my place tomorrow, and I'll explain then..."

***

As Evan opened the door to Jake's apartment, his nose with hit with a cacophony of delicious, mouthwatering odors. Stacked all over Jake's apartment were loads and loads of takeout containers from restaurants all over town. From what Evan had seen, it was an impossible amount of food even for two healthy furs like him and Jake to devour.

"Evan! Come in! Hope you're hungry!" Jake gestured for the lion, patting a paw next to him on the sofa.

"Finally having another cheat day?" Evan asked, sitting down on the couch. An enormous pizza sat in the coffee table in front of him.

"Nope." Jake replied. Again, he was shirtless, showing off his amazing physique. Only a loose pair of shorts covered him at all. He reached over and opened the pizza box. It unleashed a wave of smells of cooked meat and melted cheese. "Bon appetit."

Cautiously, Evan reached for a greasy slice and started munching. "So, just what are you planning now?" he asked.

"Get this: If we can't find a fat fur to slim down, we'll make one..."

The cream-colored lion swallowed a hunk of the pizza. "Uh-oh...is this why..."

"It's a foolproof plan! We get you all big and fat, then I'll help you get skinny again! You'll be even fitter than before! Skinny to fat to abs! It'll be great!" Jake was excitedly bouncing up and down on the couch. "I talked to Miranda about it and she thinks it's a great plan!"

Evan shoved the rest of the slice into his mouth. "I dunno. I mean, I'm not sure about putting on a bunch of weight..."

Jake reached out a paw and patted Evan's sprouting belly. "I don't think you'll have a lot of choice in the matter as it is..."

Evan could feel his cheeks burn bright red. "...how big?" he asked meekly.

"Well, I mean, the bigger you get the more impressive the loss will be. And considering ju-"

"Just tell me how big you want me." Evan interjected.

"...around 500 pounds?"

The cream-colored lion nearly choked on his second slice of pizza. "God! That's absolutely massive!"

"Not really. Have you not seen the size of the furs in this town?" asked Jake.

"It's massive for me! That'll be tripling my weight almost!"

"Yeah, but I'm sure you'll enjoy the ride," replied Jake. "You already love eating, clearly. Why not make a few million bucks off of it?"

Evan once again almost choked on his pizza. "A few million dollars?!?"

"Miranda did some back of the envelope math and think that's the cut you can make."

"Damn, with that money I'd be set for life..."

"Well, what do you say, fatty? I mean, it sounds like it'll be easier than finding a willing fat ass in this town."
113121.title: A New Plan

1131211.content:
"210? You've only gained a few pounds in the past few weeks? You've been eating like mad, right?"

Evan nodded as he repositioned himself on Jake's couch. The cream-colored lion had just stuffed himself full of sushi on his way over to the swimmer's apartment. His globe of a belly stuck out prominently, his shirt riding up past his bellybutton. Lazily rubbing a paw on the swollen mass, Evan leaned his body against the arm of the couch, laying slightly.

"Damn. This isn't going to work," muttered Jake. "At this rate, you won't be probably fat until...God, three years from now? Ugh, that's too long." The svelte lion started packing around the apartment, thinking of a plan.

"I'm doing the best I can," Evan said. "I dunno what's wrong. I was packing it on pretty quick a while ago. But I have no idea what it might b-"

"Wait! Quite! I think I just thought of something!" Jake stood at the living room window, looking down at the rotund furs waddling up and down the sideway stories below. A smirk grew on Jake's face. "You just need to get big. Doesn't matter how. In fact, it might be for the best to get you huge without all that junk food. It'd ruin your body and be a hard habit to break..."

"So, what are you thinking then?"

He jabbed a paw at the window. "This city is full of lard buckets. We find one who's willing to...donate a few hundred pounds of fat, and..."

"...put it in me somehow?"

"Exactly! And it'd be really easy to slim you down afterwards since you didn't really eat your way to being a quarter ton!" the swimmer said excitedly.

"Okay, but how? Liposuction is a thing, but...reverse liposuction?" Evan asked.

"I'll call around. There are a few doctors in this town who owe me some favors. The only thing to do is find a willing participate and..." Something caught Jake's eye outside. "Him. I bet I can..." The swimmer rushed to the front door and quickly slipped his shoes on. "Stay right there! I saw someone who would be perfect! Be right back!"

Jake slammed the door behind him. "Well, it's not like I'm going anywhere anyways..." The lion grumbled as patted his gut.
1131211.title: Slow Progress

11312111.content:
"And how are you feeling today, Alexander?" asked Jake as he slowly paced up and down the hospital hallway.

"Drained. Utterly drained," the cheetah on the other end of the line said.

"Well, they did take nearly four hundred pounds out of you! Too bad they couldn't get the rest! But I'll help you trim off the rest of the fat when you've recovered."

"Wonderful. And you sure you don't want any compensation? Money is not really an issue and I-"

"Nope. Nothing. That's part of the deal, after all!"

"Gosh, first this procedure then having Jake McCarthy as a personal trainer! What luck!" the cheetah said joyously.

"Hey, I guess you were just jogging in the right place at the right time! Rest up, Big Cat. Training starts next week!"

"Yes, sir!"

Jake ended the phone call and slipped his phone back into his pocket. He let himself back inside one of the hospital rooms where an incredibly obese lion laid unconscious. His blob of a belly and flabby chest nearly ripped the hospital gown apart. The sheet on his lower half did little to hide his tree trunk sized thighs. The oxygen mask strapped around his face was almost slipping off thanks to his enormous cheeks. The surgery had been a success.

"How our fat friend doing, Dr. Kirkpatrick?" Jake asked the bulky bear who was fiddling with knobs and dials on machine hooked up to the gigantic lion in front of them.

"Stable," the bear said stoically.

"Shame you couldn't pump him up bigger," the swimmer said, examining Evan's new form.

"Another pound and he would have popped," Dr. Kirkpatrick grunted.

Jake placed a paw on Evan's doughy belly. Brushing back fur, he saw long and jagged red marks along his skin. He let out a low whistle. "Wow. 577, right?"

"Thereabouts." The bear didn't look up from the chart he was scribbling on.

"Not for long. He's on The McCarthy Plan."

***

"Alright, tubby. Turn to the side..."

The obese lion's entire body wobbled about as Evan awkwardly shuffled himself around. He hadn't gotten used to moving with the several hundred extra pounds of fat on him. He hadn't gotten used to how slow and cumbersome it was to be a quarter ton fur. Hissing slightly as he moved, the stretchmarks all throughout his body shot out bolts of pain. Since the procedure, Evan's skin felt tight as a drum. But the creams the doctor gave him were healing his damaged skin, though the healing process wasn't over yet, and he needed Jake's help to make sure cream was spread all through his enormous new body.

Jake snapped a few photos. He needed some "before" shots for Evan's portfolio. "God, look at that belly hang..." he teased while taking a few more photos. "Sorry, I'm not gonna help hold that thing out of the way when you need to pee!"

Evan blushed. "Shut up and take the photos."

"Alright, dough boy. Now let's see that fat a-" Suddenly there was a knock on the door. "It's unlocked!" Jake shouted.

Panicked, Evan grabbed a blanket hanging off the couch and quickly threw it over his nearly nude body just before the door swing open and in walked a cheetah. A little on the chunky side, the feline sported a decent gut and thick thighs. The clothes he wore clung to all of his curves, and they appeared brand new.

"Oh, hey Alexander!" Jake said. "Come by to pick up your stuff?"

"Yes, I did...Am I interupting something?" he asked, trying not to stare at the oversized lion standing in Jake's apartment.

"Nah, just taking some shots of fatso over here before he gets put on The McCarthy Plan!" The swimmer held up his camera for emphasis. "Isnt that right, tubbo?" The grey lion tried yanking off the blanket wrapped around Evan, but he held on to it tightly.

"Oh, uh, okay..." He spotted a box nearby the front door with his name written on it with a marker. "Are these the workout out clothes you got me?" Alexander asked Jake.

"Yep! So you'll have no excuses for tomorrow!"

The cheetah grabbed the box before heading back out the door. "Alright, see you tomorrow, Jake!" He slammed the door behind him.

Jake turned back to Evan. "Drop the blanket, lardo! I've got more photos to take!"
11312111.title: Success

113121111.content:
Huffing and puffing, Evan fought to move his thick, blubbery thighs past each other as he plodded along on the treadmill. Puddles of sweat formed in the underarms of his tent-like workout shirt. He hissed in pain as his chaffed thighs rubbed against themselves. Whipping beads of sweat frol his brow, he spotted Alexander and Jake walking by, finished with their own workouts. While it had only been a couple of weeks since working out with the swimmer, Evan could tell that the cheetah was already seeing results. His remaining potbelly had noticably deflate, and his arms were becoming less flabby and more built.

"Hey, Fat Cat. Nearly done?" asked Jake as he and Alexander approached him.

"Y-yeah...a couple of minutes left," Evan replied, gesturing to the treadmill console. 2:14 it read in bright red number.

Jake looked over at it. "Nah. Can't be right." He mashed a paw down on the buttons several times. The remaining time now read 32:18. "There you go, Tubbs!"

"Jake! I...I don't think..." the ballooned up lion struggled to say.

"Shut up and keep waddling, Tubbs. I gotta hit the showers." Tossing his gym towel over his shoulder, Jake strolled away.

Alexander stood there for a moment. He gave Evan a half-hearted smile. "You're...you're doing well!" the cheetah said, giving Evan a pat on his shoulder before going off to join Jake.

Evan whined as he watched the timer on his treadmill tick down. A deep grumble roared from the lion's vast belly. He remembers his meal plan for the rest of the day. A single chicken breast, no sauce, and a cup of steamed rice. He sighed. Jake was practically starving Evan, and the lion wasn't sure how mu-

"I've gone loco, amigos!" the potty Chihuahua on the gym's television yelled. "All this week at El Burrito Diablito we had one dollar taco! Ay Caramaba! Come in today and bring your burro!"

Evan licked his lips. "Tacos do sound pretty good right now..."

***
Had Evan not been so focused on destroying the mountain of tacos in front of him, he might have noticed Alexander take a seat opposite of him.

"Hello, Evan. Doing well?"

Evan nearly choked on the half taco he was currently munching on. "Oh! Uh, Alexander! Umm, hey! Didn't expect to see you..."

The cheetah chuckled. In front of him were a few tacos of his own and a side of refried beans. "Don't worry. Jake would kill us if he saw us here. This'll be our little secret!"

"Cool. Thanks. I just can't live on rice and chicken alone!" replied Evan. He saw Alexander eyeing the pile of crumpled up taco wrappers on the tray in front of the heavy lion. Little did the cheetah know it was Evan's third tray.

"Yes, Jake's awfully ambitious. I don't think he realizes that, uh, bigger furs aren't used to eating so little." He began unwrapping a taco. "After all, that's probably a normal snack for you, huh?"

"Oh, yeah. Totally," Evan mumbled. It actually wasn't. Never in his life did he crave so many tacos. But never in his life did he have such cravings for so much food, to eat so much.

"Same. Back in my...um, fatter days I'd swing by here and grab thirty or forty tacos. That, or go down to the Creamery, squeeze myself into one of the booths, and have chocolate sundae after chocolate sundae."

Chocolate sundae. The moment thoses words left Alexander's lips, the lion immediately lost interest in the few remaining tacos on his tray. His mind instead immediately became fixated upon ice cream, gallons and gallons of it. A twinge shot through his already full belly and it suddenly craved for the sweat treat.

"God, that sounds so good right now..." groaned Evan, who was now staring off into space.

"Doesn't it? I might stop by there for a scoop. Can to join me? My treat!"
113121111.title: Cravings

choices: Find out what foods Jake craves
Stay on the swimmer's good side
1131211112.content:
The following morning, Evan was woken up by the feeling of his boxers being yanked almost entirely off his nearly naked body. The now fat cat, through eyes blurred with sleep, frantically looked around his bedroom and spotted two things.

First was the several empty cartons of ice cream scattered across this bedroom floor. Although he had turned down Alexander's offer, the lion couldn't get ice cream off of his mind. Stopping by the grocery store on his way home, Evan intended to buy just a little bit, just enough to curve his cravings. But he ended up walking out of the store with tens of thousands of calories of the tasty treat which he greedily devoured that evening.

The second thing he noticed were the two furs in his bedroom: Alexander and Jake. The latter had a furious look on his face, and seeing the destruction from the night before along with the drips of dried ice cream all over the his fur, Evan instantly knew why. Today was supposed to be a weigh-in day, hence why Alexander was there and why Jake had let himself in. The swimmer was hopping mad to find his protege had gorged himself, breaking from his strict diet.

"Jake! I'm sorry bu-" Evan began, but the swimmer gave him a hard shove, rolling him over onto his vast stomach and exposing his blubbery rear in the air.

"Jake, I think Evan..." the cheetah said, his words trailing off. But the grey lion ignored him as he started taking off his black leather belt and yanking Evan's tail out of the way.

"Fat fuck..." muttered Jake before looping the belt and bringing it hard over Evan's fattened backside. It made an ungodly slap, and the cream-colored lion hissed in pain. "Sad sack of crap!" Jake brought the belt down again, harder this time. Once more, Evan yelped in pain. He tried rolling back over, but Jake shoved him back into position where he kept wailing on the lion's expansive ass, hurling insults as the cheetah stood meekly in the corner. After a dozen and a half lashing, Evan's rear felt battered and bruised. Tears had formed in the corner of his eyes from the pain he had endured; he could feel welts forming on his butt.

Panting, Jake treaded the belt around the loops of his jeans. "Don't...cheat again," he grunted. "Got it?"

"Yes...Jake," whimpered Evan.

"We'll do the weigh-in another day," Jake barked to Alexander before storming out of Evan's apartment. "I'm too pissed to do it today."

***

Evan hissed as Alexander applied another ice pack on his beaten rear. The cheetah moved the pack in slow circles around one of the blobs. It had taken him nearly an hour to ice the mass that was the lion's backside.

"I just don't think Jake knows what it's like to...you know, be fat," Alexander said. "He doesn't know that big boys get really bad cravings. I remember one time when I was big, it was the first day of a new diet for me but I had a really hankering for fried chicken and...well, let's just say that I had a small mountain of chicken bones to deal with the next day."

"Still, it doesn't excuse him from...well..." Evan shifted his backside, making the dual blobs jostle around a bit.

"Yeah, I agree with you there," Alexander replied. "You'd think he'd understand? I mean, his own diet is so strict that he must know what it's like to get those insatiable cravings."

The lion perked up a bit. "...I think you're right." He looked over his shoulder towards the cheetah nursing his rear. "We should give Jake a taste of his own medicine. Find out what kinds of things he craves and unleash him on it! Maybe then he'll get off of his high horse!"

The skinnier cheetah looked hesitate. "Oh, I don't know about that...Jake has quite the temper and I'd rather just stay on his good side."
1131211112.title: Just Desserts?

1131212.content:
The enormous cheetah sat on Jake's couch, nervously rubbing his paws together. The grey sweatsuit he wore clung to ever single roll and fold of his soft, blubbery body. Jake, his astounding physique constraining the roly-poly cat, stood stoically looking at the blob of a fur in front of him.

"And you really want to shed all that fat?" he asked. There was not a note of kindness in his voice.

"Yes sir!" the cheetah enthusiastically said. "I'll love to finally get skinny! And money's no matter! I can ha-"

"Oh, Alexander," Evan interjected. "I'm sure Jake will work for fr-"

"I'll send you an invoice for myself services," Jake said, completely ignoring Evan. "How much do you weigh, Alexander?"

"Umm, my scale broke when I hit 600 pounds..." the cheetah said shyly.

The grey lion let out a low whistle. "Pretty big. This'll be quite the change." He then turned to face Evan. "Quite the change indeed. Are you sure about this, Evan? I mean, we could just go bac-"

"I'm sure! I'm sure!" he cut in. "I'm sure Alexander will be a wonderful client!"

Jake let out another loud sigh. "Fine. Fine. You're loss, I guess. Alright, big cat, let talk about your diet..."

***

Evan huffed and puffed as he tried to force the flaps of his jeans closed. "Come...on...these fit...the other day..." But the sea of soft rolls that made up the lion's gut made the task essentially impossible. Defeated, he shimmied the size 48 jeans off his legs, entire body wobbling, and tossed them into a corner of his bedroom. "Don't need them anyways..." he muttered. That was true. He had no roommate, and since it was his day off, Evan had nowhere he needed to be. The lion shuffled his heavy body towards the living room, not before digging his boxers out from the vast crevasse of his rump.

Having eaten away all of his savings in Port Zaftig, Evan soon came up short on rent. With no money and having failed to find a job in light of spending his days stuffing his face, the lion was forced to pack things up and head back to Bastion. He couldn't ask Jake for financial help. Not like he wanted to, anyways. After turning down Jake's offer to blimp up for his diet plan and hooking him up with Alexander, the grey lion soon stopped returning Evan's calls and texts altogether. At first, he reasoned that Jake was busy getting Alexander into shape. But after a few weeks of it, Evan figured Jake no longer wanted to see him for whatever reason.

Evan did bring back on thing from Port Zaftig: A newfound love of eating. He was easily hired back at his old job at a pizza place. These two factors meant the lion's waistline ballooned up quickly. It was nearly a year and a half since moving back to his hometown and Evan was already pushing past 300 pounds. He tried dieting a few times, yet each attempt failed and soon Evan was back to sucking down pizza after pizza.

The lion collapsed on his sofa, his wide butt landing perfectly on the dent his weight had made in it from his sedentary lifestyle. The couch creaked under his weight. He struggled to lean forward due to his belly, knocking away the takeout containers in his coffee table until he found the remote buried underneath. Evan fell back again. His belly and moobs jostled around wildly. The simple task made him out of breath again. It was a strange twist of fate for him. While in Port Zaftig, he stood out for being a skinny fur among so many fatties. In Bastion, he stood out as being a fatty amongst so many slender furs.

Flipping through the channels, Evan was annoyed to find mostly boring programming and stupid daytime talk shows. He stopped switching through channel when he saw a vaguely familiar cheetah on the screen. He was thin, but Evan could tell there was some serious muscle under his form-fitting suit. Sitting beside him was Jake, looking as slim and svelte as ever.

"So, Alexander, you've had quite the weight loss journey," one of the shows host side. She gestured to a cardboard cut out of an extremely obese cheetah beside him wearing a familiar grey sweatsuit. "What kicked everything off?"

"Well, I was tired of being so big. And one day, I was jogging in the park, struggling to even move, when this lion pops up. 'Hey, big guy! Wanna train with the Jake McCarthy?' he asked and I'm all like 'THE Jake McCarthy?!?' and he was all like...wait, what was his name again?"

"Doesn't matter," Jake cut in.

"Right. Anyways, so I get started working out with Jake an-"

Evan shut off the television and toss the remote away. He then cursed himself. It would take him a while to bend down and pick it up again later. An effort he wasn't looking forward to. A loud grumbling erupted from his flabby gut. Reaching for his phone next to him, he dialed up the pizza joint he worked at.

"Yeah, it's Evan...Yeah, even on my day off...so I want two large supremes, a pepperoni, large, and a medium...yes a fourth pizza, don't judge me...and a medium ham and pineapple... charge to my account."

His thick paw hit the end call button and the fat lion sat on his couch awaiting the four pizzas that would make up his breakfast. As he waited, he thought about getting rid of jeans altogether and just wearing sweatpants all the time. He'd rarely outgrow those.

Evan's mind began wandering to the offer that Jake made so long ago. 500 pounds was such a huge number to get to. It scared Evan at the time. But now, here he was. In a couple more years, he'll undoubtedly be a quarter ton, and that's not with the allure of millions of dollars behind it either. A few more years beyond that and Evan figured he'll probably be as big as Alexander was when he stumbled across him and offered the chance to have Jake slim him down. Now that cheetah is fit and trim and probably rich. Now Evan was fat and lazy slowing turning into a blob. Why didn't he just take Jake up? Why didn't he ju-

A knock came in the door; his food must be here. Evan shook his head. He must have been lost in thought for quite some time. He cursed at himself. The pizza guy was here and he didn't have any pants on at all.

"Oh well," he mumbled. "Not like he hasn't seen my fat ass before..."
1131212.title: An Actual Taker?

choices: Ask Jake to change up the diet plan
113122.content:
Evan stared at the thick, brown, grainy sludge in his cup. It was one of the meal replacement shakes Jake had prescribed to him. It was filled of powders and ancient grains and God knows what. The svelte swimmer wrote out the instructions and had plenty of the ingredients shipped to Evan's apartment. All he had to do was mix it up and suck it down.

The lion took another small mouthful. It tasted like old dirt. Plugging his nose, he brought the cup to his lips and pounded down as much as he could muster. Evan nearly gagged but he was able to drink half of the shake. He sighed seeing how much was left. Taking the rest of the shake to the living room, Evan figured he could nurse the rest while watching television.

If it wasn't bad enough that the shakes tasted awful, it also had the effect of leaving Evan incredibly bloated all the time. His belly was in a semi-permanent state of feeling full to the point of bursting. Evan's shirts covered embarrassingly little of the dome of his gut, and the poor lion could hardly see he toes past the mass.

"That's the probiotics doing their work!" Jake had assured Evan. "They scrubbing your body clean of all those toxins! And judging by how much you're blimped up, you must of had a load of toxins in you!"

The lion gently rested a paw on his painfully swollen belly as he eased himself down onto the couch. Grabbing the remote, he flipped on the television. Knives of Justice VII was playing and that was just as good as anything to mindlessly watch as he tried to drink the rest of this "healthy" shake.

The program went to a commercial break. A cow dressed in overalls popped up on the screen.

"Jen and Barry's has all new flavors of ice cream available now! Check out Chocolate Cacophony! Caramel Collision! And Fudge Tribulation! Get them at your local grocery store! C'mon! Get MOOving!"

Evan whimpered seeing the ice cream. It had been weeks since he had any. Jake's diet plan was incredibly strict, and the lion wasn't suppose to have any sweets at all. But ice cream was his absolute favor. Maybe a little bit wouldn't hu-

He shook his head. "No. Gotta stick to this diet. Gotta stick to this..." Evan glanced down at the muck in his cup. "...diet. God, this stuff is terrible. Maybe I can bring it up with Jake to make his whole diet plan more...palatable."
113122.title: Shake Blues

1131222.content:
"God! You look...enormous!" Jake said, grabbing either side of Evan's round gut and giving it a shake. The nearly spherical ball of fur, dense and firm, swayed as the fit lion wobbled it around.

Evan said nothing. His cheeks burned with embarrassment.

Jake stepped back to take in the bellied lion in his apartment. Evan looked pregnant, overdue with triplets. The globe that was his cream-colored gut stuck out a little more than a foot, and sagged down slightly forcing Evan to leave his shorts unbuttoned. So big was the lion's belly that even Evan's largest shirt couldn't cover him up. When he sheepishly entered Jake's apartment, his formerly baggy grey shirt was almost riding all the way up to his chest.

The swimmer stared dumbfounded. It had been little over a week since Evan started on The McCarthy Plan. Yet the lion looked like someone had stuck a bicycle pump in him and blew him up. "Did...did you cheat on the diet plan I gave you?" asked Jake. Even if Evan did, he figured there was no way he could have eaten himself to the size he was now unless the lion got himself trapped in a grocery store or something.

"No!" lied Evan. It wasn't exactly a lie. Overcome with cravings, the lion did splurge a bit and bought a couple of cartons of Jen & Berry's. But there was no way that ice cream could have blown up his belly this big.

Rubbing a paw along his temple, Jake let out a sigh. "Uh...let's cool it with the diet plan for a while," he said. "I obviously need to tinker with some things. Is that cool with you?"

"Oh, yeah. That sucks, but you gotta do what you gotta do," replied Evan. Jake didn't see the lion's tail wag in delight.

***

A loud sucking sound came from the straw as Evan drank up the very last drops of the chocolate milkshake he was drinking, the third for the day. Crumpling up the paper cup, he tossed it into the garbage can sitting in his kitchen. The lion gave his firm full belly, swollen noticably larger due to the near gallon of milkshake digesting in it, and burped a little bit. He then went back to the task at hand: Boxing away all of the strange and bizarre ingredients Jake had shipped over for Evan's dietary shakes.

The cabinet he store them all in was nearly empty aside from one plastic jar way in the back. His belly made it hard for him to reach inside as it bounded against the edge of the kitchen counter. Sticking a paw in, inch by inch he pulled the jar out. But his paw caught an edge of the lid. The jar flipped on its side, rolled out of the cabinet into the countertop, and bounced onto the floor where it continued rolling away for several more feet.

Evan cursed. He walked over and picked it up, which took considerable effort because of his engorged belly getting in the way of him being able to bend down. Legs spread wide apart to make way for his gut, the lion bent at the hips until he was able to grab the jar.

The jar was of one of probiotics Jake had sent as part of the shakes. Evan never really bothered to read any of the labels on the containers the swimmer gave him. "Pro...bascilla...mono...nuxtra..." he muttered, trying to pronounce the name of the probiotic. He gave up pretty quickly and glanced at the rest of the label. Evan never before noticed the bold text on the back.

ATTENTION: IT IS ADVISED YOU AVOID THE FOLLOWING FOODS WHILE TAKING THIS PRODUCT IN ORDER TO AVOID DIGESTIVE ANOMALIES: KALE, BROCCOLI, SPINACH, ANY DAIRY PRODUCTS, CASHEWS, AND ALMONDS.

"Well, damn..." Evan said, looking down at his blimp of a belly. He figured out what made him blow up so rapidly. Even though he only cheated on his diet with a bit of ice cream, the dairy in it must have interacted with the probiotic in his shake, making his belly swell up massively.

"Jake will glad to know this," he thought to himself. Then, Evan realized something. If he told Jake about what he found out, then he'd be back on The McCarthy Plan in no time being that the flaw in his plan would be fixed. His stomach churned at the diet of sucking down another shake that tasted like dirt. Perhaps this could be something he kept to himself, for a while, at least.
1131222.title: Talk About Lactose Intolerance

114.content:
Walking nearby one of the parking lots at the northern end of the beach, Evan spotted a vixen struggling with a cooler. While not as comically obese as some of the patrons on the sands, she certainly hadn't been skipping any meals recently. Chub poked out from the straps of her bikini top, the bottoms were being swallowed up slightly by her pudgy rear, and a small belly pouched out from her midsection. Fatter than Evan liked his girls, she was still very pretty to the lion. She shuffled along for a few steps, awkwardly carrying the cooler until she lost her grip. The cooler landed with a dulled thud in a small cloud of sand.

"Hey! You need help with that?" Evan asked as he approached the female deer.

"Yes, please!" she replied. "I'm not too far, just over there!" The vixen gestured over to where several umbrellas had been set up in the sand a few hundred feet away.

The lion grasps one of the cooler's handles; the vixen grabbed the other. Lifting it up, Evan was caught off-guard by its heavy weight and was surprised the vixen was able to lift it up at all. "Oof, damn, having a party over there or something?"

"No, just me and the boyfriend today."

Boyfriend? Rats, Evan thought.

"What? And he's not here to help you out?" he asked.

"Oh, it's alright. Besides, that slowpoke would taken longer anyways," the vixen said, checking out the lion from a corner of her eye. "I'm Emily, by the way. You're...not from around here, are you? Are you on vacation?"

"I'm Evan. Actually, I just moved here. Like, literally just moved here. I live at the Flora Street Apartments not t-"

"Oh! Troy and I live there, too!" Emily cut in. "We live on the fourth floor."

"Nice. I'm on the seventh."

"We should have you over for dinner! To welcome you to the city!"

"That'd be nice. Like, I literally don't know anyone in Port Zaftig yet," Evan said.

"Well, you'll be our guest and...ah, here we are." The two reached the umbrellas stuck in the sand. A large bag with a beach towel laid beside them. On the ground another beach towel, an enormous bright red one, laid in a sizable crater in the sand.

"Oh, Troy's not here," Emily said as the two set the cooler down on the sand. She squinted, looking out into the ocean. "Ah, there he is, taking a dip."

Evan brought up a paw to his eyes, shielding them from the bright sun. Light glimmered off of the water nearly blinding the lion, but Evan could just barely make out small patches of red fur out in the sea.

"He'll be out there for a while," the vixen said. "But why don't you cover over to our place tonight? I'm making fried chicken, and I always make too much!"
114.title: Beach Bum

"...Troy's going to help me find one. Right, Troy?"
1141.content:
Troy belched out loud. The vixen walked by her boyfriend, reaching down and giving him a pat on his gigantic belly. "Had enough, babe?" she asked. The red fox nodded. Emily kissed him on his pudgy cheek before grabbing his empty plate. "You good too, Evan?"

The lion nodded, lazily rubbing a paw on his overstuffed belly. "Yeah. God, that was good!"

"Thank you!" the vixen replied, grabbing his empty plate as well. "Just wait until dessert!" She wandered off towards the kitchen. Evan caught a glimpse of her rump, straining the fabric of her shorts as her cheeks bounced up and down.

The red fox belched again before giving his own gut a pat. "Hell of a cook, huh?" asked Troy. Emily's boyfriend was easily four times the size of Evan. The obese fox would have looked out of place anyplace else beside Port Zaftig where it seemed like most furs were several hundred pounds overweight. But Troy and his medicine ball sized belly fit right in, though it didn't find in the black shirt he was wearing which had rode up several inches since dinner. This didn't surprise Evan much; the red fox had eaten enough food that would have lasted the lion several days.

"Oh yeah, hell of a cook," Evan replied, his paw still caressing his swollen belly. "Need a girl like that in my life. How did you two meet?"

"Uh, internet," Troy said back.

"Lucky guy."

"I know, right? Great in the kitchen...great in the bedroom..." The obese fox said, though he muttered the last part as to not be heard by Emily in the kitchen. "I saw you checking her out. Jealous much?" Troy gave Evan a wink. The lion certainly was a bit envious of the fox. The vixen, while a bit chubby, was curvy in all the right places and had a cute face to match. Somehow, the blobby fox had landed a girl like Emily. Evan wasn't sure why. While Troy was conventionally handsome, he was nearly a quarter ton. Evan not only felt he had a better body than the red fox, but a body that could do more to please a girl. The lion's mind boggled at the mechanics of love-making with a fur as big as Troy. How, after all, could he please a girl when Troy probably couldn't even reach his own junk.

"Whatach boys talking about?" asked Emily as she walked back into the living room, carrying two plates with a thick slab of chocolate cake.

"Nah. Single for now, but..."
1141.title: Girl Talk

choices: Devour the rest of the cupcakes
11411.content:
Through the windows of his living rooms, Evan watched as Troy waddled out of the front doors of the building and towards his car. The business casual clothes his worn clung tightly to each roll of his flabby body. As the red fox rested his massive body onto the driver's seat, the vehicle dipped down noticably. And the obese red fox was gone moments later.

The lion stood watch in case Troy came back. In his head, Evan went over the plan again.

"Sweatpants? Check. Condoms? Check. No underwear? Double check."

He quickly made his way down towards the apartment Troy and Emily shared. The lion's cock was half-erect just at the thought of getting some action and formed a noticable bludge. Evan didn't fix it. If Emily saw, it would mean less explaining he would have to do.

The whirring of a vacuum cleaner could be heard as Evan knocked on the door several times. The lion heard the mechanical noise stood and the sound of heavy footsteps making their way towards the door. The vixen quickly swung the door open. She was wearing a frumpy getup. Clearly, Emily wasn't expecting company.

"Oh, hi Evan!" she said as she tried fixing her fur up a bit. "Uh, we're you looking for Troy? He just left for work a second ago an-"

"Nops," Evan said as he confidently strode past the chunky vixen into the apartment. He leaned an arm against the back of the couch. "I'm actually here to see you..."

Evan cut her off again. "Doesn't Troy help clean at all?"

She shook her head. "No, no. I take care of it since Troy is a bit too big to do it himself. He mostly..." Emily gestured towards the sunken cushions of the couch where it was obvious Troy always parked himself.

"Hmm. I bet you do a lot for him. Does he do a lot for you?"

"I mean, he pays for the apartment, the bills, the food, th-"

Evan cut her off once more. "What's it like having a boyfriend as big as Troy?"

Emily perked up. "Oh, I love my big foxy boy! He's so sweet and kind an-"

"I was talking about in the bedroom..."

The vixen started to stammer. "E-evan...that's private...stuff..."

He chuckled. "What can I say? I'm a curious cat! The mechanics of it all must be so...difficult..."

The vixen shifted around uncomfortably. "It's...hard, yes...I have to do most of the work..."

"But he returns the favor, yes?"

Emily looked towards the ground. She said nothing.

'Oh, oh poor girl...that's such a shame..." Evan shifted his position. His hips now stuck out slightly and the outline of his erection was now obvious. He caught Emily glancing at it for a moment.

"Evan, what are you up to..."

The lion sauntered up to the chubby vixen. He place a paw on her chubby hip. "I just wanna make you felt good..." he growled, grabby a pawful of her rear with his other paw. Emily bit her lip slightly.

"It has been a while..." she moaned, wrapping her arms around Evan's slender waist.

Nothing made Evan hungrier than an afternoon of lovemaking. The naked lion wandered through Emily's kitchen looking for something to sate his appetite. Peaking into the fridge, he saw that it was loaded with food yet none of it was particularly appealing to him.

His stomach growled as he shut the fridge door. Looking around the kitchen, the lion spotted a small platter with a half dozen enormous vanilla cupcakes, each twice the size of one of his paws. Licking his lips, Evan made his way over and grabbed one, quickly devouring it.

Eventually, Emily made hear way into the kitchen. Naked as well, her heavy chest swung slightly as she moved. "Evan, did you find anything to..." The color drained from her face as she saw the lion bit into a third cupcakes.

"Fuck me, these are good..." he groaned. Frosting coated the fur around his mouth.

The vixen shuffled around nervously. "Oh, um, Evan...I made those special for Troy..."

"...so good..." moaned Evan, taking another hearty bite.

"Umm...I can whip you up something to eat of you'd like!" she quickly suggested. "I can make a great grilled cheese sandwich!"

Evan shoveled the rest of the cupcake into his mouth, reaching out for another as he chewed.

"Please, Evan. Those are really, really special ones I made for Troy..." she quietly pled. "Let me make you something else! Just please don't have anymore!"
11411.title: Afternoon Delights

12.content:
"I guess I've figured out why the doors are so wide..."

As Evan wandered around his new neighborhood looking for something to eat or someplace to buy food, one of the first things he noticed was the sheer enormity of nearly all the furs. The smallest fur he saw was probably still weighed well over 300 pounds. Not like the lion was judging or anything. But it's hard not to notice when nearly every fur you see takes up most of the sidewalk and waddles at half the speed you walk. The only furs that weren't so obese were obvious tourists wearing "I Port Zaftig!" shirts and were snapping photos.

This, though, wasn't Evan's concern. The lion's concern right now was filling his stomach on something more substantial than the gas station snack he had been living off of for the past four days.

After nearly an hour of walking, Evan spotted a few potential places. First, there was a a local bakery which smells of delicious freshly baked bread and various baked goods as he walked by. He also found a Mexican restaurant that was serving its lunch special pretty soon, and Mexican food was one of Evan's favorites! He had also passed by a seedy tavern along the way. Not only may they have something to eat there, but he could get a nice beer with his meal too. Or there was a pizza place called Purgatory Pizza.

Then again, Evan practically brought no food with him. A meal certainly sounds nice, but he should probably do the mature thing and actually go shopping. Luckily, there was a supermarket not too far away from his apartment.
12.title: Food, and where to get it

choices: Sit and eat at the park
121.content:
The inside of the Heavenly Bakery smelt, well, heavenly. Delicious aromas wafted into the shop from the ovens in the back. The store smelled of baking bread and cookies. Display cases were filled to the brim with baked good, dozens and dozens of fresh loves of bread were placed in baskets, and tall elaborately decorated cakes sat in a cooling case.

The store itself had nobody else in it. It was late in the morning so Evan reasoned that this must be a bit of a regular lull in the day. The lion meandered around the shop. His eyes were drawn to a display case for doughnuts. However, it was almost empty sans about a half dozen. These doughnuts, though, were more like small cakes. Each one was bigger around than the lion's paw and stood several inches tall.

Evan was eying one in particular, chocolate with chocolate icing on it, when he heard someone come in from the back. She was a panther with beautiful black fur and a cute face. A little shorter than Evan, her busty chest and pudgy belly strained the buttons of her flannel shirt. Thick hips and thicker thighs stretched her khakis tights.

"Hello, sir!" she said. "Sorry to keep you waiting! I had to pull a few things out of the oven. Is there anything I can help you with?"

"Oh, no problem. I was just browsing. I haven't really eaten anything all day so far. I spent move of the morning moving my stuff up to my new apartment," explained Evan. "So now it's time for breakfast!"

"Did you just move to town?" asked the panther.

"Yep, literally got in a few hours ago. And now I'm in the mood for doughnuts, but I just need to figure out which one..."

"One? Huh," the panther then grabbed a box from behind the counter. She sauntered over to the display case and placed all six of the oversized doughnuts in there. "Take them all! Consider it a welcoming gift! Besides, it's getting close to noon so these will probably end up in the day old bin soon anyways."

"Really? Thank you!" Evan eagerly took the heavy box from the panther. "Are you sure I don't owe you anything?"

"Nah, just promise you'll be a regular here!" She flashed him a smile.

"Oh, I know I will be..."

"Katie," she said.

"Katie! Got it! I'm Evan! You know I'll be back again! Now I'm going to go eat these! I'm starving!"

"Alright, enjoy!" She waved as he left the bakery with his bounty.

Evan was one his way back to his apartment to devour the doughnuts. But he had spent most of his time in Port Zaftig in his apartment and there was plenty to see. There was a nice park across the street from his apartment. Maybe it would be nice to eat break there. The box he was carrying wasn't to unruly. He could eat while exploring the city as well.

"Barkeep! Another!"

"Sir, you're, like, the only one here. There's no need to yell."

The thick panda manning the bar slid Evan another bottle of Grendel's Own Cranberry Cider. It was the fourth the lion had and, along with the small mountain of fries he devoured, he was starting to feel a bit bloated.

The tavern itself had been pretty empty, the only other patron having left half an hour ago. Evan chalked this up to it being still pretty early in the afternoon.

Cracking open the bottle, the lion brought it up to his mouth and started chugging down the delightful brew. The front door of the tavern squeaked opened, and the lion glanced over to see that a tiger walked in, blinking as his eyes adjusted to the darkness in the tavern. The first thing Evan noticed about him was, like the lion, this tiger was quite trim, maybe even a few pounds less than Evan. He also noticed that, unlike the tourists who frequented the streets in tacky flowery shirts and shorts, this fur was dressed in a simple shirt and jeans.

The tiger glanced around, spotting Evan at the bar. He sauntered up, taking a seat one stool away from the lion.

"What'll have?" the panda asked.

"What do you have that's dark?" the tiger said.

"Broken Skull Stout."

"I'll have one of those." The panda poured a tall pint glass full of dark brown liquid and placed it in front of the tiger. He brought it to his lips, made eye contact with Evan, and raised his glass to make a silent cheers. The lion raised his bottle in return. Both took healthy swigs of their drinks.

The two sat silently drinking. The panda grabbed a bus tub full of glasses and plates and went into the back. The tiger then leaned closer to Evan. "Hey, is it just me, or this town full of fat asses?"

The lion leaned over. "Yeah, I know, right?" Evan said in a hushed whisper. "Where are all the hot babes at? Isn't this supposed to be a beach town?"

"They're all sheltered away at the resorts on their private beaches," the tiger replied. "And I'm not going to book a night there just to stare at eye candy. Besides, I-" He stopped talking when the overweight panda walked back in. She grabbed a couple of empty plastic tubs from the bar and walked into the back again. As she did, the tiger pointed at her wide rear and made a dude gesture.

Evan chuckled. "I've been here less than a week and still haven't found anyone with a BMI under 60."

The tiger stifled a laugh. "Oh man, that's funny! Are you just visiting?"

"Nah, I moved here just the other day. You?"

"Same. Work transferred me here. The ManufactCo branch needed a new Assistant General Manager. I'd have rejected the transfer if I knew how many fatties this city had." The tiger stuck out a paw. "The name's Matt."

The lion shook his paw. "Evan."

The tiger lifted his glasses and downed what little remained of his beer. Evan did the same with his own. "Alright, next rounds on me!"

Sometimes Matt just got a bit more 'handsy' and 'playful' after a few drinks, Evan had found that out from experience. And there was no harm in that! The lion thought; the odd slap on his rump, random kiss on the cheek, occasional flick to the waistband of his underwear... a few teasing gropes to his package... it was all in good fun, teasing, it didn't mean anything, ya'know, bro stuff. It's not like it was gay or anything, that would make it weird. Before they could stumble towards the exit, however, the bartender called out to them; a buxom, yet rather portly looking bunny with long blond hair and wearing a rather revealing tank top emblazoned with 'Big Jugs n Mugs', the name of the tavern. "Yer hot wings, fellas, ya'll wouldn't want em to go to waste now would ya?" pointing down to a half finished 'Medium' sized bucket of spicy Buffalo wings, of course, Port Zaftig's definition of Medium was more like a Supersized Jumbo Sized.
