The building was not what Evan had expected. Though he wasn't quite sure what he had expected. It was essentially a giant cube. Very large, tombstone grey and had a small pair of double doors on the front. But the building had no signage at all, and the windows were blocked out with paint. It was very secretive, you would never know this was a gym from the outside. Matt had arrived earlier, so the plan was to meet up inside.

The interior thankfully looked nothing like the outside. The lobby was shiny and sleek, like 60s space age decor. There was a pleasant, calming vibe to the building, though it didn't look like any sort of gym or health spa Evan had ever been too.

At the front desk, a rather bimbo looking receptionist was filing her nails. She was a Mink, with long blond hair and wore mostly pink. Her waist was trim, but her breast and thighs were huge, creating a cartoony hourglass figure. She had to have some sort of difficultly walking around with so much cleavage. Evan knew he shouldn't look, but it was hard not to stare when everything was so... prominently on display. With a pudding butt like that, this lady clearly only worked here, didn't workout.

"Oh uh, another new recruit?" the Mink spoke up, the disinterest simply palpable in her voice, she glanced him over "Must be. You're the last to arrive. Go see Levi, down the hall to your left. Room 310."

She pointed the way with her file, and the tubby lion thanked her for the quick advice before heading off.

He quickly found the room he was supposed to go to... it was a waiting room, full of a dozen other applicants!

Even was shocked, he hadn't seen a room full of this many 'normal sized' furs in months. In Port Zaftig it was a rarity to see anybody weighing under 300 pounds, and here was a whole room of them!

Looking around the room, he actually felt a twinge of intimidation. They were all men, many of them pretty buff, or thinner than he was. There was a good possibility he was the fattest guy in here!

Matt was sitting in the corner of the room, next to a empty seat, looking slightly less confident than usual, obviously trying to suck in his gut. Matt waved the lion down to sit next to him.

"Whoa, this is kinda bizarre" Evan whispered,

"Right? Everyone can fit on one seat here" Matt replied, "Uh... I mean I guess that shouldn't be weird, but after so long in Port Zaftig..."

"I know..."

Evan glanced round the room to study the various applicants.

Opposite him was a tough looking red Kangaroo wearing a loose singlet, he was super tall and very beefy, with wide shoulders, bulging biceps and a thick tail.
Next to him was a Shark dude, almost as tall as the roo and just as strong looking, he had a few piercings on his left eyebrow and headphones draped around his neck.
Nervously sitting next to him was a much smaller black Mouse, with big round ears and peach colored mask of fur on his face - he was the smallest in the room and looked a little shy next to everyone else.
To his left was a very average looking Coyote, chatting to a similarity average, albeit sporty looking Dingo
In the far corner was a rather stoic looking Hawk; slightly buff, wearing blue jeans and most stereotypically a shirt with the flag printed on it.
Clockwise, to Evan's side of the room, sat a... Lizard? Dragon?? Evan wasn't quite sure what he was since he was wearing a huge leather jacket over where his wings might be. It'd be rude to ask. He was certainly big enough to be Dragon, with brilliant green scales and yellow underbelly.
Next was a jockish looking Raccoon, wearing a Letterman Jacket, he seemed pretty bored and was tapping away on his phone.
A well built grayish-blue Donkey sat next to him. He looked like a workhorse, with strong arms, a stubble on his chin, and a small gut.
Next to him was a smug looking orange Fox relaxing in his seat, he was very slender and wore a tacky, far-too-loose Hawaiian print shirt. He reminded Evan of a movie star.
A rather zen looking Crow sat in the seat besides him. His hair was messy and wore a rather baggy looking wool jumper that was well worn with age. But his ratty garments didn't conceal how noticeably fit the avian was, he was lean, but well built.
And lastly a slightly podgy looking white goat with short horns, wearing khaki pants and a black shirt. Evan deduced he probably was a gamer, due to the bold print 'GAMER' printed on his T.

Then of course was Matt and himself, who were suddenly feeling like they might not be the only studs in town.

An awkwardly long wait was filled with lots of small talk about the weather and local sport, as one by one the other candidates were ushered into the back office to personally meet with Levi. As Evan was the last to arrive, sadly he would be last to be seen.

Finally his turn came, and Evan couldn't deny he was actually a little excited to meet this mysterious Levi for the first time. Entering the room, what he saw surprised him - a very tall, and exceptionally muscular horse sat on an wide executive chair, behind a very expensive looking desk. He had light brown fur, a dark muzzle and a shaggy blond mane. He looked like a veteran gym junky, with massive guns and well defined pecks. The only part of him that didn't fit with what Evan's expectations was the extra large dough-ball belly that firmly sat in the horse' lap. He looked perhaps like a retired gym owner, Evan concluded.

"Ahh, you must be Evan" the horse jovially called out, rising to his feet to shake the lion's paw (his bulbous gut brushing against the desk, pushing it across the floor an inch or two). His handshake was as strong as the rest of him (Evan had to wiggle his poor crushed fingers afterwards to make sure none had been broken.).

"Oh, now you're a good looking guy, Evan" Levi proudly stated, blatantly gazing over the lion's body like he was appraising a fine specimen of farm cattle. "I think signing you up is practically going to be a formality"

That was a good start! "Heh, thankyou, I guess" Evan sheepishly replied, a little bit of confidence returning to him. After seeing all the fitter/slimmer men waiting outside, Evan was worried this wasn't going to be a sure thing.

"So, uh, I'm still not totally clear what I'll be doing here exactly?" Evan inquired, taking a seat.

"Heh, well I'll tell you what I told everybody else, this gym was set up with a purpose, you've seen what Port Zaftig is like. Blubber-balls everywhere."

Evan nodded his head in agreement, but thought it was perhaps a bit rich for the horse with the boulder gut to say such a thing.

"Well are plan here is to start a fitness revolution. We want furs that can set a better example working for us, the best of the best. Real studs."

That was an odd choice of words, but the lion generally got the gist of it. "Uhh, but Levi, I'm not exactly the most... um, svelte Lion anymore, are you sure this is the right job for me?" Evan grabbed a handful of his gut and gave it a wobble for emphasis.

Levi almost burst out laughing, "Compare you to the average joe on the street, you look like toothpick... and don't worry, our program is all about making furs like you bigger. Much bigger."

"Oh like muscle building?"

"A little bit."

That was good news for Evan, one of the main things he wanted out of this arrangement was a program that could help him get really buff. And maybe something that would help him lose a few pounds in the process.

"...besides," Levi continued, "it's all about the mindset really, our profile dosser indicates you, and your tiger pal are really prime material for this program."

"Huh?! Dosser?... You've been keeping tabs on us??"

"Well, we had to make sure you were the right man for the job. You wouldn't have been invited here otherwise. Don't take it the wrong way, but this is a very private organization, we can't introduce ourselves to just anybody."

Evan wasn't sure what to think of that. It was a little creepy. Just what did they know about him?

"Now all I need from you is to sign this contract." Levi continued, suddenly pulling out a monster sized document from out of a draw. Oh crap, Evan knew there had to be a catch.

"Hey, don't give me that face" Levi pleaded, "Look this is just standard legal mumbo jumbo, you know, covering our ass over liabilities. I promise you, we can make you a very rich man Evan. You know, I can even hand over your first paycheck right now, in advance, have a look"

The horse pulled a cheque out of his breast-pocket - that's right, Evan realized, they hadn't had a chance to talk about pay yet. The lion took one look at the figures written down and almost gasped, he'd be paid how much?? Needless to say, this vastly paid him more than his job at ManufactCo. And this was just meant to be a part time thing, right?

"But we're already running over time, Evan, sorry but I really think I need an answer right now. Do you want in? Do you want to become part of project Immotus Movens?" The horse pushed a fancy golden pen into the lion's paws.

"Uh wait, but I can't just sign..."

"Oh come now, it's easy, your friend Matt did it without any fuss"

He did? A few alarm bells were sounding off in the back of Evan's mind, something wasn't quite right. But if his friend did it maybe he was overrating. And after all, he signs legal documents all the time, practically any time he updates his phone he's asked to sign some weird document... and that was a lot of money...
12311121111.title: A deal with the

1232.content:
"Alright, big cat, nearly there..."

Evan helped Matt down the hallway towards his apartment. The tiger was having a hard time walking as he was stumbling around and tripping over his own feet. When they got to the door, Matt fished his keys out of his pocket and tried unlocking the door. On the fourth failed attempts, Evan grabbed the keys from his and unlocked it himself, leading the tiger inside.

"Home, sweet *urp* home!" The tiger yanked off his shirt and undid his pants, tossing both to the floor, exposing his orange and black stripes and extremely distended belly.

For the past week, the two felines hung out a lot, typically at one of the local bars. Both would have drinks, but Matt would usually overdo it and Evan would help him get back to his place. The lion didn't mind. He enjoyed Matt's company and liked having a friend in this city. Plus, Evan would stay over and, in the morning, the two would go to a delightful diner, The Hangry Hippo, for breakfast where Matt usually tried curing his hangover with an ungodly amount of greasy food.

All that food and empty calories in the loads of beer he was drinking was having an immediate impact in his waistline as his stomach had ballooned out into a beer gut, looking as if the tiger was swallowed a basketball. It now looked like an overinflated basketball thanks to the uncountable beers he had that evening.

The lion kicked aside the discarded clothes as he shut the door behind him. Matt, clad only in a pair of white boxers, sat on his living room couch flipping through channels on the television. Evan took off his own jeans and shirt. Both furs were comfortable with each other's bodies ("We're the only studs in this town full of fatties!" Matt had once said) and the apartment wasn't air conditioning properly so it was usually pretty warm.

Feeling buzzed but not drunk, Evan made his way over to the refrigerator where Matt always kept the best beers in stock. One benefit of being friends with the tiger was that he always let his friends take beer. So the lion opened it up and grabbed a bottle of Sierra Madre IPA.

"Grab me a can of Schmoor's!" Matt yelled from the couch.

"Haven't you had enough?"

"hAvEn'T yOu HaD eNoUgH?" the tiger jokingly mocked back.

Evan chuckled as he grabbed a can of beer for his friend. "Hey, where do you keep your bottle opener?" he asked.

"Umm, it should be...bottom drawer by the fridge?"

Inside the drawer was a random mess of various kitchen utensils: Spatulas of assorted sizes, whisks of assorted sizes, most of a set of measuring cups, and at the very bottom was the bottle opener. As Evan yanked it out, a large plastic funnel fell forward from way back in the drawer.

"Find it?" Matted asked from the couch.

"I did!" Before Evan shut the drawer, he saw the funnel and had a fun little idea.

"Where's my beer?" asked Matt as the lion walked behind the couch. He looked over to see his friend holding the funnel. "Wassup with that?" he asked, gesturing towards the funnel.

"Up for a little challenge, big cat?" asked Evan, cracking open a can of beer with one paw.

It took a second for Matt to understand as he glanced back and forth between the beer and the funnel. He smirked. "It'll be just like college again!" the tiger said giving his bloated belly a slap. "Alright, let's fill up this tank!"

Matt leaned his head back and Evan placed the funnel into his awaiting mouth. As he slowly poured it in, the tiger started sucking down the cheap beer. Evan cracked open another Schmoor's readying it for the funnel.

gulp gulp gulp gulp

In went the second beer with no signs of slowing down by Matt.

gulp gulp gulp gulp

Evan watched as the tiger's already rounded belly swelled up even more, his orange and black stripes stretching out further and further apart.

gulp gulp gulp gulp

Beer #3 down, on to Beer #4, and the lion could hear creaks and groans from the inflating stomach.

gulp gulp gulp gulp

Matt's eyes winched in pain as Evan poured in the sixth beer.

gulp gulp gulp gulp

Evan was getting worried now. The tiger looked ready to burst.

gulp gulp gulp gulp

When the funnel emptied one last time, Evan pulled it from the tiger's mouth. Matt gasped for air while running a paw along his ridiculously full belly, hissing in pain.

"Alright... alright...your tur-" Before he could finish his sentence, he slumped over, quickly passing out and falling asleep.
1232.title: Filling the Tank

125.content:
The parking lot to the Super-D-Duper Mart was filled with anything but cars. Tents, banners, and furs of absurd sizes filled the space. GRAND OPENING read a wide banner at the front of the supermarket. Evan found a parking space a few blocks away and walked towards the commotion.

"Uh, what's all this about?" he asked a young but fat Golden Retriever who was wearing an oversized shirt with the store's logo on it.

"Oh, it's our grand opening spectacular!" he replied. "Free food! Free merch! Go around a take a look! And here!" The dog pinned a button to Evan's shirt.

I SHOP AT SUPER-D-DUPER MART AND I ONLY SHOP THERE, the button read.

"Uh, thanks?" The lion wandered around the makeshift festive for a bit. The Retriever wasn't lying; tons of free food was given out. Burgers, hot dogs, ice cream, even those comically large turkey legs the lion only saw on television. He grabbed a couple of hot dogs and made his way through the crowd, quickly observing that he was easily the thinnest one there. Even the thinnest fur beside him was still double the lion's weight.

From the far end of the parking lot, Evan heard the sounds of cheering. Squinting under the bright sun, he saw there was a small stage set up in the distance with a sizable amount of furs surrounding it.

Three furs sat on the stage, the table in front of them had an impossible amount of pies. While all three were quite fat, the grey wolf in the middle took the cake. Judging by the legs Evan could count sticking from under his enormous body, it looked like the fur was being supported by three chairs. And no wonder, the wolf looked like he weighed half a ton with his gigantic gut spilling out in front on him, pushing his fat thighs apart, and hanging just a foot above the ground. He looked to be wearing a black and grey track suit made out of a silky yet sturdy material. The logo on it, two Ws with a line in between them, could be seen from Evan's distance.

"Wait...is that..." The lion turned to a chunky squirrel next to him. "Is that William...uh, McDuffy? That competitive eater guy?"

"It is!" she squealed. "Can you believe it?!"

The squirrel's friend turned to her and said, "He's probably only here to promote William Wear."

"William Wear? What's that?" asked Evan.

"'Clothes for the huskier fur', I think that's what the stupid ad keeps saying," he replied.

"For the hu-" But Evan was cut off by the roar of applause. He looked over to see the wolf, an innumerable amount of empty pie tins in front of him, face stained with red cherries. A heavyset ferret with a microphone took the stage.

"Ladies and gentlemen, you're winner, Zaftig City's own William McDuffy!"

The wolf raised an arm that looked bigger than one of Evan's legs in celebration as he dabbed his face clean with a towel. While looking over his admiring crowd, he made eye contact with Evan, an intrigued look soon appearing on his face. Just then, two heavily muscled rhinos approached the stage and helped him waddle offstage and onto a motorized wheelchair that looked more like a short tank with armrest.

Evan watched as William spoke in the ear of one of the rhinos, gesturing towards the crowd. The rhino nodded and scanned the crowd through his dark sunglasses until he spotted his target. He made his way through the crowd, making his way directly towards Evan.

"Mr. McDuffy would like to see you," the rhino said in a firm voice.

"What? Why?" the lion asked.

"That's Mr. McDuffy's business. He'd like to see you now. But Mr. McDuffy understands if you are not available right now. So Mr. McDuffy is willing to host you at his private estate this evening. "
125.title: Wolfing it down

1251.content:
"Wait...Willy?"

Evan couldn't believe it. The fur standing (or rather, sitting) in front of him was Willy (or rather, William) McDuffy, his best friend from middle school. The two met in sixth grade when they were assigned seats next to each other in Mr. Murphy's mathematics class and they were joined at the hip since. They always played together, joined the same sports teams, took the same classes, they even had the same crushes. But at the end of eight grade, Willy found out that he and his family we're moving around the country that summer. The internet wasn't a thing, and neither was social media, so their friendship quickly dissolved.

"See! I knew you'd remember!" said William, bouncing up and down in excitement. The motorized wheelchair groaned under him.

"Wow, sorry for not recognizing you at first," apologized Evan.

"Well, I look a bit different since middle school," he replied. Quite different, in fact. Both him and Evan were teased by the other boys for being so skinny, easy two of the skinniest furs in the school.

"Yeah, I'll say. So, what happened after your family moved?"

"Things weren't too bad after we moved. I went to high school and met this girl there. Trish was her name. She was my high school sweetheart. We were actually together all four years. I even proposed to her on our graduation day! But shortly after that, she (for a lack of a better term) broke my heart. The next thing I know I'm face deep in a half gallon of ice cream. Depression hit me hard. I ate my feelings, and back then I had a lot of feelings to eat. But then something amazing happened one day: I entered a hot dog eating contest shortly after my 19th birthday! It sounds silly, I know. I actually only entered it because of the free food. The next thing I know, I smashed the competition! Soon enough, I had an agent and I was on the road from competition to competition! And here I now!"

"Huh, I didn't know eating competitions could be so lucrative," said Evan.

"The prize money can be good. But I also got signed for endorsements, advertisements, and hey, I've even got my own clothing line!" He gestured to the massive shirt covering up his torso. "And don't tell anyone else this but I just inked a deal for a reality television show: So You Think You Can Eat? Keep it a secret! Nobody is supposed to know yet!"

"Wow, it really looks like you-" One of the rhinos interrupted Evan to whisper something to William.

"Ah! Georgio is telling me that we need to head out if I don't want to be late for the autograph signing. Hey, why don't you come by to my place this evening for dinner? It'll be great to catch up with you!"
1251.title: Willy the Kid

12511.content:
"So, there's another reason I asked you here tonight..."

Both furs sat on the patio of William's home which overlooked the beaches of Port Zaftig from a tall hill nearby. It was early in the evening. The air was still quite warm, and the wolf had changed into an colossal pair of shirts, his upper body bare, exposing a sea of rolls and folds.

"Oh? And what's that?" Evan took a sip of his rum and coke.

"Well, I'm retiring. From competitive eating, that is. Not all of it, though. I'll leave the door open when it comes to major events. But when it comes to the smaller competitions, I'm pretty much done. I've got other things to focus on! My clothing line, my television show, you know."

"Alright, that's good. But what does your retirement have to do with me?" asked the lion.

"This is going to sound crazy, but I want a...protégé. I want you to be my protege!"

The lion choked on his drink a little. "What? Me? Why? I've never done any sort of competitive eating! And I've never really been interested in it."

"I think you have potential!" William assured Evan. "And you'll have me to support you! I can teach you all the tricks I know! You'll be a natural soon enough!"

"Maybe," Evan said. "I have some reservations about it."

"Come on! The money's really good! I won't even take any sort of fee or anything! It's not like I need the cash anyways!"

"But still, I'm not sure about, well..." The lion eyes up William's naked torso, a shapeless blob of lard.

The grey wolf laughed, his whole body wobbling as he did so. "You mean this?" He grabbed one of his rolls and gave it a hearty shake. "This is more my fault than anything else. I've never been that keen on exercise, so I didn't really bother with burning off everything I ate. Besides, not all completive eaters are fat! Haven't you seen Tajiri Hakimono? That guy is thinner than you and even he'll give me a run for my money! So, what do you say, Evan? Please?"
12511.title: The Proposal

125111.content:
"Alright, well, I guess we're making progress..."

It had been a little over a month since Evan agreed to be William's protege, but the lion was nowhere near where he needed to be if he was going to be a successful competitive eater. Simply put, the lion didn't seem to have the stomach to do it; he didn't have innate ability to wolf down obscene amount of food like the wolf could. Sure, he was able to eat more now than he could before, but that was only a meager difference.

"Ugh, I'm sorry, but I really don't think I could eat anymore..." The lion pushed away the remaining quarter of the pizza William had made up for his lunchtime practice. The two furs were in the lush dinning room of the grey wolf's home. Being his protégé, William insisted that Evan move into the guest room in his Port Zaftig home, figuring that the lion would benefit living around his new coach.

"Really? Not another bite?" pled William.

The lion let out a belch. "Not unless you want me to pop..."

The grey wolf drove his electric wheelchair over to one of the wide windows of the dinning room and looked out it towards the ocean. "This...this won't do," he said mournfully.

"I'm sorry! I'm doing my best!"

"Hey, I believe you!" William said. "It's just that... I'm thinking you might need a little more...assistance."

"Like what kind of assistance?"

William turned his wheelchair towards Evan. "There's a doctor in this city. You wouldn't know of him. But he and I have talked back and forth with about appetite stimulants. I could call him up and see how his research is going."

"So, drugs? Isn't that going to be problematic?"

"If you use stimulants before a competition, yes. Then you'll be disqualified. But when it comes to training, any trace of them should be out of your system before your first meet."

"I dunno. Still sounds risky," the lion warned.

"I see. I was also thinking about bringing in Dr. Ruben Cioran. He's a psychologist who has done loads of work when it comes to performance and mental conditioning. I've done him a few favors, so I think he'll be willing to check you out."
125111.title: A Rough Start

choices: Get something to eat from the kitchen
1251111.content:
In the living room turned temporary clinic, Evan stood clad only in a pair of white briefs as the beefy bear poked and prodded his body with all sorts of medical instruments the lion didn't recognize. The obese wolf sat in his wheelchair in a corner observing the situation in silence.

"Arm, up." said Dr. Kirkpatrick, sternly and stoically. Evan obeyed, and the bear clamped the lion's bicep with a kind of pliers, taking note of the device's readings.

"Dr. Kirkpatrick, it's been hours," William chimed in. "I'm sure that our friend here is more than healthy enough for whatever it is you've got cooked up."

"With all due respect, Mr. McDuffy, I'm the doctor and you aren't," he replied, not looking away from the forms he was scribbling on. "But I do think there shouldn't be any issues. Turn that direction please." The lion faced away from the bear. Dr. Kirkpatrick reached for a metal briefcase. Inside were dozens of identical vials each with a small injector attached to the end. He grabbed one, pulled up the lion's underwear, and pressed it against one of Evan's buttcheeks. A click, then a stabbing pain. The lion yelped as Dr. Kirkpatrick disposed of the now-empty syringe. "The glutenous maximus is the ideal location for injection. It ensures a slow yet steady released of the formula."

Evan pulled his underwear back down and rubbed the sore spot on his rear. "Are there any side effects that I should worry about?" he asked.

The bear paused for a moment, staring off into space. "...No. Nothing that a standard, over-the-counter medicine can't handle. Now, come here, William. I'll show you how to handle these medical waste containers."

***

An unusual sharp, stabbing pain in the stomach woke Evan up that night. The lion groaned as he clutched his abdomen. It had been several hours since the first injection, so he reasoned that it might be finally taking effect. But the typical pangs of hunger wasn't what he was feeling. Food or medicine, one ought to do the trick.
1251111.title: Dr. Kirkpatrick

choices: On the eve of Evan's first competition...
1251112.content:
"And what do you think this looks like?"

"It looks like...another blob of ink."

For the past two weeks, much of Evan's time was spent with Dr. Emmory Cioran, a wispy, elderly white-furred mouse with wild, unkept grey hair. Hours and hours were spent putting the lion through all sorts of psychological tests and evaluations, many of which Evan was unaware even existed. William held off on any sort of eating practice, arguing that Dr. Cioran's time was limited and more important.

"If he can crack into the skull of yours, you won't even need any sort of practice!" the nearly immobile wolf claimed.

On the evening of Dr. Cioran's final night in Port Zaftig, he arranged a special event. A kind of "exhibition", as he called it. Evan was called into the dining room were a venerable feast was laid out before him. Whole roasted chickens and legs of lamb. Honey-glazed ham and pot roast. And loads upon loads of stemmed vegetables and bread rolls. Sitting somewhat away from the table in his electric wheelchair was William who was receiving a lecture from the Doctor as the lion entered.

"...and so, with the right kinds of psychological condit-"

"Hush, hush, Doctor!" said William, gesturing towards the lion as he took a seat at the table. "Evan! Just in time! The Doc was talking all about you!"

The mouse approached Evan, placing a hand on his shoulder. "As I was telling you, Mr. William, with the right kind of psychological conditioning, nearly any sort of mental barrier can be overcome so long as one's physical self isn't harmed in the process. This is what I hope to demonstrate with the Subject-"

"Uh, I have a name," Evan chimed in.

"...with the Subject here tonight." Dr. Cioran continued, ignoring the lion. From a coat pocket, he pulled out a small dinner bell, a bell that the lion had seen dozens and dozens of times over the past weeks with the doctor. "Three rings! That's all it'll take!" The mouse shook the bell.

Ding!

Evan didn't know what to expect. Nothing from what Dr. Cioran told him in all of their tests and evaluations prepared him for what might come next.

Ding!

The lion turned nervously towards William who was looking on with eager anticipation. "William, I don't th-"

Ding!

The lion's eyes shut.

Half a second later, Evan awoke. The first thing he noticed was the intense pain radiating from his stomach. He clutched his abdomen, now rock hard and packed with a monstrous amount of food, a belly as if he were nine months pregnant with triplets. Through eyes squinting in agony, Evan saw much of the food that once ladened the dinning room table was now gone, no doubt sitting in his gut. Chickens were reduced to carcases. Legs of lambs were picked clean. Dr. Cioran and William stared at the lion silently. The wolf's face held a expression of shock; the mouse's a sense of smug satisfaction.

"Doctor, I think you did it."
1251112.title: Dr. Cioran

125112.content:
William and Evan promised that they would catch up again. But as quickly as their friendship reignited, it was snuffed out. The colossal wolf got swept up with all of the projects he was working on, all the competitions he was taking part in, and he just couldn't make time for Evan. The lion stopped receiving his texts when it became apparent William was far too busy for his former best friend.

Evan never quite meshed well with Port Zaftig. He could never make any friends with the locals, job were strikingly hard to come by, and once the lion's savings dried up, he had no real choice than to move back to Bastion. This didn't upset Evan all that much; he wasn't leaving much behind.

His family and friends welcomed him back with open arms. Even the pizzeria Evan worked at previously hired him back on the spot. And soon enough, it was like the lion never left.

One Saturday evening many months later, Evan was sitting in his tiny apartment doing the usual things he did on those lonely nights: Get high, masturbate, and mindlessly watch television. With a glazed look in his eyes, he flipped through the television channels not looking for anything in particular.

He stopped, though, when Evan saw that one of the cabel sports channels was airing footage of an eating competition that happened earlier in the day. Celebrating on stage was an overweight orca with plump limbs and an overinflated belly. He was wearing a tank top, stretched tight over his stomach, with a logo: Two Ws with a slash between them. Onto the stage came a super heavyweight wolf, William, though he seemed to have slimmed down a bit, enough at least to let him walk onto the stage without assistance. The orca was handed one of those comically oversized checks for a quarter of a million dollars.

"Maybe I should have taken Willy up on his offer..."
125112.title: Back to Bastion

1252.content:
"Do you like science fiction?" William asked as one of the trim Dalmatians brushed crumbs off of his flabby chest. The enormous grey wolf had invited Evan over for dinner, yet the lion wasn't sure why. There wasn't much conversation during dinner as William was too occupied devouring piece after piece of fillet mignon being brought up to his mouth by one of his servants, a small team of nearly identical and fit Dalmatians. Much of the evening for Evan was spent awkwardly waiting for William to finish his small fest.

"Kinda, I guess. I watched Paw Trek when I was a kid," Evan replied.

Another of the Dalmatians wiped William's mouth with an elegant cloth. "That's good. That's very good. Boys, leave me and our guest alone." Without a word, the dogs left the spacious and adorned dinning hall, leaving Evan alone with the half-ton wolf.

The hyper-obese wolf stared at Evan from across the long dinning room table for a few moments before speaking. "Have you traveled much, Evan?"

"Uh, not really. My family was pretty poor growing up so we weren't able to do much traveling besides going to family reunions."

"Same. My parents were just over broke when I was growing up," William replied. "Which was a shame. I always wanted to see the world, visit other cultures, see historical sites and whatnot."

"So, uh, why don't you?" asked Evan. He figured he knew the answer, but he didn't want to blurt it out impolitely. "I mean, you seem to be doing well with the mansion and clothing lines and ea-"

"Because I'm far too fat to travel." The fat wolf stated the obvious. "If I wanted to travel across the country, I'd have to hire a personal cargo jet to get me around! Far too difficult."

"So, why not lose some weight, then?"

The wolf chuckled. His jowels bounced around. "Tried that. But for every pound I lost, I gained two in its place. And I'm getting impatient. I'm still pretty young and full of vigor. I want to see the world now! Not decades in the future when I'm finally able to fit in only two airplane seats!"

"Okay. Uh, sorry. But I'm a bit lost. What does this have to do with anything about me?"

William lended forward in his extra wide chair. A couple rolls of fat bunched up around his chest. "Psychology has made incredible advancements in the past few years, did you know? It's hardly talked about, but they are now able to, as it were, swap minds between furs. That's what I would like your help with!"

"Wait, what?" Evan said, puzzled at the seemingly impossible proposition William was putting before him. "You want to sw-"

"Swap bodies, yes!" William cut in. "Temporarily, of course. Six months, at most. You're body will be returned in a fine condition, I promise. And you'll be rewarded quite handsomely. I was thinking six figures, but we can hammer that out later. Money is no object. I all ask is that we keep this between ourselves. I can set things up so you won't have to deal with any of my businesses and whatever. But you'll still need to pretend to be me while all this happens. I don't want my shareholders dumping their stock when their poster boy suddenly has no idea what his own products are all about."

"This is all nuts!" barked Evan. "You can't possibly switch bodies with me! There's no way th-"

William cut in again. "I assure you! It's entirely possible! I've seen the procedure happened flawlessly with my own eyes!"

"Then why don't you swap out with one of your servants? Those Dalmatians are skinny enough, I guess."

The grey wolf scoffed. "I can't trust those idiots with my body," he replied. "They'd probably hijack it and pretend to be me for the rest of their life."

"And what makes you trust a stranger?" retorted Evan.

"I don't necessarily trust you. But you seem to know little enough about my dealings that it wouldn't make sense for you to pose as me," he replied. "You'd crash my businesses and lose everything in no time."

"Well, that's certainly true."

"So, what do you say, Evan? I get to borrow your skinny body and travel around the world, and all you need to do is relax and, uh, 'fill in' for me while I'm gone. All for a pretty penny. A good deal, is it not?"
1252.title: A Good Deal

12522.content:
The older white mouse with wirey hair adjusted the electrodes on Evan's temple. The second attempt with the body swapping procedure had fail, sending several painful shocks through the lion's body.

"Why do I have to be awake for this?" grumbled Evan. "William gets to be asleep for this. Why can't I?" Feet away, the enormous grey wolf laid anesthetized, his heavy limbs strapped down to the reinforced metal table.

"It's for reasons I have neither the time nor the patience to explain," Dr. Cioran muttered. He indelicately ripped off one of the electrodes, taking a bit of Evan's fur with it. The lion hissed in pain as the doctor reapplied it an inch from it's original site.

After a few minutes of tinkering, Dr. Cioran seemed pleased with his work. "All is better," he spoke as he returned to his station where boxes of knobs and dial sat.

"And what if it do-"

Before Evan could finish the sentence, the mouse had flipped a few switches which sent bolts of electricity surging through the lion's body. Evan shortly lost consciousness as his vision filled with darkness.

***

"Mister William? Sir?"

Evan felt a nudge on his shoulder. Groggily opening his eyes, the first thing he felt was his body, particularly numb and feeling as if several wet blankets covered his frame. When his eyes adjusted, he spotted a youngish Dalmatian standing over him.

"Mister William? Will you be having breakfast in bed today? I'm afraid your food will be cold by the time we transfer you to the dinning room."

Evan immediately remembered the procedure, and the agreement he made with William, and knew the part he had to play. "Oh, uh, yes. Yes, I'll take it in here." It was strange hearing a voice that wasn't his leaving his mouth. But then again, it wasn't his mouth to begin with.

"Alright, sir. We'll bring it it. Give us a minute." The fit Dalmatian, dressed in a velvety maroon jumpsuit, bounded out the door, gently closing it behind him.

Evan went to work examining his new body. He tried to sit up but the immense weight of his belly and chest made it impossible to get up on his own. Lifting up his paw, moving slowly and heavily, the lion-turned-grey-wolf poked and prodded any inch of fat he could reach. "God, it worked..." he muttered as he squeezed a ham-size moob. Soft fat oozed out from his chunky paw.

The bedroom door burst open and the four Dalmatians, all in matching maroon jumpsuits, marched in. Two pushed trolleys loaded with plates of sausages, bacon, eggs, and pancakes. Evan's belly let out a deep roar. He wasn't sure when was the last time this body had any food. Parking the carts next to the bed, the four expertly propped up Evan's gigantic body. The dogs did all the work. All he needed to do was feel his lardy body jiggle and shift around as it was adjusted to an upright position. Evan eyed the food as they worked. At first, he was shocked by the sheer quantity of the meal in front of him. But then he remembered the incredibly fat body he was now in possession of and became intrigued at seeing just how much his colossal belly could hold.

Having propped Evan up, the team of Dalmatians assembled by the tray, each taking a forkful of breakfast in their paw. Lining up, the first Dalmatian held up a fork covered in limp bacon up to Evan's mouth. He felt a little uncomfortable with the situation; Evan had never be fed like this before. But knowing he was supposed to act, and eat, like William, he opened his maw and the servant shoveled the bacon in.

The next Dalmatian stood ready for Evan to devour some sausages. Evan eagerly ate those. The next approached with cheesey eggs. Evan swallowed those with gusto. And soon he was mowing down bite after bite of breakfast, a Dalmatian ready with another forkful the moment he swallowed. For nearly an hour, this process continued uninterrupted except by the occasional burp from Evan.

As his breakfast disappeared into his gut, creaks and groans sounded from Evan's oversized belly. Two of the Dalmatians turned to each other and nodded. One moved to the opposite side of the bed and yanked down the sheet covering Evan's belly, exposing an ocean of grey-furred flab. Before Evan could protest, the two dogs sunk their paws into his stomach and began gently massaging the mass. He groaned, and seconds later a deep belch rumbled out of him.

"Good breakfast today, huh, sir?" asked a Dalmatian. It was the one who woke him up in the morning. Evan recognized the small triangle of black spots on his left cheek. He held up some sausages and Evan ate without question.

For the rest of breakfast, two of the Dalmatians worked on Evan's overfilled belly while two fed him. The pairs would occasionally switch. While all were excellent belly rubbers, the Dalmatian he recognized from the morning seemed to perform his task with a particular kind of skill and enthusiasm.

Evan was on the verge of a food coma when he finished the tens of thousands of calories worth of breakfast food. Without a command, a servant dabbed his mouth and cleaned him a bit, getting grease off of the furred that surrounded his mouth.

"Need a nap, sir?" One of them asked. Evan nodded. Or, he nodded as best he could with the heavy collar of fat around his neck.

The team joined up and spoke amongst themselves for a few moments. One seemed to volunteer himself for something. The other three nodded and exited the room, carts in tow.

The familiar Dalmatian approached the bedside and resumed massaging Evan's blimped-up belly. "Figured I'd help with this, sir, to avoid any indigestion or heart burn."

"...'s good," muttered Evan, drifting off to sleep as paws delicately ran over his new hulking belly.
12522.title: A Good Meal

choices: Ask Joey about how he got hired
Ask Joey about his personal life
125221.content:
Sitting on the widest recliner that he ever saw, Evan watched television on the biggest screen that he ever saw. At his side was a small platter piled high with lemon cupcakes. While they weren't one of Evan's most liked flavors, he sussed out that they were one of William's favorite and figured that if was going to indeed pass as the obese wolf whose body he inhabited, he better learn to love them.

As Evan shoved an entire cupcake into his mouth whole, one of the Dalmatian servants (Jacob, he had learned) walked into the lounge, phone in paw. "Mister William? Phone call."

"Woof iff et?" Evan chewed for a second longer and swallowed the cupcake. Crumbs and frosting were smeared on his bulbous cheeks. "I mean, who is it?"

The Dalmatian shrugged. "Evan, I believe his name was."

Surprised, Evan reached out a pudgy paw for the phone. Jacob turned and left his oversized master in peace.

"Uh, hello?"

"Oh, hey, 'William'!" It was weird to hear his own voice over the phone. "How's things going over there?"

"Oh, good! Things are good! No problems here. How about on your end?"

"Great! I landed in Paris earlier today and now I'm having lunch at this fancy bistro! Just waiting for dessert and...Garçon!" William babbled something in French before returning to the call. "Anyways, just wanted to call in and check up on things!"

"Oh, like I said, the-"

In walked three of his Dalmatian servants, dressed swim trunks. One carried a towel big enough to fit over a car over his shoulder. "Ah, Mister William? Your bath is ready," Jeremey (one of the servants) said.

"Bath time, huh? I think you'll like it!" William said over the phone. "I gotta admit, though. It's great to fit into a shower stall again! It's... dessert's here! Gotta go! Have fun!"

***

It took the better part of an hour for the team of Dalmatians to scrub down Evan's enormous body. But they were thorough. Every roll and fold was cleaned, even his most private rolls and folds. He had to stiffel a yelp of surprise when Evan felt his huge buttcheeks part and washcloth slip inside the crevasse. The Dalmatians showed no signs of embarrassment at having to clean those areas of massive wolf body in front of them, so Evan just had to go along with the program. Besides, the lion-turned-bulky-wolf would probably get used to the bathing situation over the next few weeks anyways.

"Ready for the oils?" asked Joey, the Dalmatian first met after awaking from the body switch. The Dalmatian team had finished patting down Evan with towels, drying him off. William's fur was incredibly soft and smooth. Surely the oils must be the key.

Joey led Evan, slowly but surely, into an adjacent room where a low, heavily reinforced table was. The Dalmatian helped Evan lower his gigantic body onto the table. He then walked over to a wall with row after row of various glass bottles of different colors and shapes. Thinking for a moment, Joey grabbed a greenish bottle. Returning to Evan, the Dalmatian poured a small amount of thick liquid onto his paws and began massaging the oil into the fur of the grey wolf's body.

Evan observed Joey as he worked the oil into his fur. The fit, young, handsome Dalmatian was still in his swim trunks. His toned body was quite the contrast to the hyper-obese blob he was massaging. While the rest of the Dalmatian servants were pretty quiet and kept to themselves, Joey was far more outgoing to Evan, often making sure he was comfortable and, more importantly, not hungry. Not wanting to lay in silence for an hour, Evan figured this would be a good time as ever for a conversation.
125221.title: Bath Time for Tubby

1252212.content:
"So, Joey, what do you do in your spare time?" Evan asked while the Dalmatian rubbed oil in a circular motion around his cavernous belly button.

"Uh, nothing much, sir," he replied. "This is pretty much a 24/7 job! After all, that's why we're bunked here so we can be ready to help at a moment's notice."

"Really? What about any days off? Have you even gotten a day off or something?" Evan asked.

The Dalmatian poured more of the oil into his paws before working it into the fur of the grey wolf's vast underbelly. "No, sir. But that's the job, I guess. I knew that when I signed up for the job. I don't mind, really. I didn't have much of a social life before getting hired on, Mister William. Well, I do mind every once in a while. Like, one of my favorite bands, The Flaming Hips, are playing tonight. But I suppose I can catch them when they come around again another time."

"You know what, Joey? Why don't you have the night off? I don't think I'll need all hands on deck tonight."

"Really, Mister William? What if the other guys find out?"

"I'll just tell them you're out running an errand for me," Evan said with a wink.

"Yes!" The Dalmatian started rubbing Evan's grey fur with renewed vigor. "Gotta get this finished first!"

***

The sound of soft footsteps woke Evan up in the middle of the night. Though his luxurious bedroom was nearly pitch black, he did spy a figure creeping beside his bed. "W-who's there?" he bark.

"Oops, sorry Mister William." It was Joey's voice. He clicked on a lamp on the nightstand. Evan saw that he was wearing stonewashed jeans and a tight black T-shirt that cling to his fairly muscular torso. In his paws was a folded black garment. "I didn't mean to wake you up. I just wanted to drop this off, you know, as a thank you for the night off." He unveiled the shirt he was carrying. On the black shirt was the stylized logo of the Flaming Hips. While the shirt was huge, Evan figured it wouldn't even come close to fitting around the huge body he inhabited. "I got the biggest size, but I think..."

"It's lovely," said Evan. "Besides, it's the thought that counts!"

Joey smiled as he folded the shirt back up and placed it on the nightstand. "Well, better let you get back to sl-" The Dalmatian was cut off by the loud grumbling on Evan's enormous gut. "Sounds like you need a midnight snack, sir. I think there are some lemon cupcakes left in the kitchen."

"Oh...that sounds so good right now..." Evan had started developing a taste for them.

"I'll grab some right now, Mister William!"

"Oh, you don't have to call me Mister William. You can call me Ev-...Will. You called me Will."

The Dalmatian smiled again. "Sure thing, Will."
1252212.title: The Night Off

choices: Take Joey out on a date
Ask Joey to join him in bed
12522121.content:
"...so then I told him 'You're going the wrong way!'"

Evan, still inhabiting the body of the comically obese wolf, chuckled at Joey's story. The Dalmatian walked besides the electric wheelchair that slowly moved Evan's immense girth as the two furs wandered around the mansion grounds. Frequently, Joey and Evan found themselves talking and touring the grounds. The lion-turned-fat-wolf certainly enjoyed their time together. The Dalmatian was entertaining company, far more interesting than any of the programs on the hundreds of channels William had subscribed to and often found himself watching. The other three Dalmatian servants grumbled about how Joey was skimming out on his duties to hang out with the boss. But eventually they stopped caring. The more time Joey spent with him meant less distractions for them and their own work.

Jude opened one of the mansion doors as the pair approached. The sunlight almost shined off of his velvet maroon jumpsuit. "There was a call from someone named Evan that you missed while out, sir," the Dalmatian said.

"Did he leave a message?"

"No. Well, yes. But I couldn't understand himself. I think he was trying to eat and talk at the same time. And he didn't leave a number."

"Oh well," Evan said, rolling past. "He'll probably call back." Jude closed the door behind them and walked off.

"What's the plan now, Will?" Joey asked the obese wolf.

Evan let out a yawn. "I was thinking about a nap. I slept terribly last night."

"Got it. Let's get you to bed!"

"Fine. Call over some of the guys to help move m-"

"Oh! I think I can handle it!" Joey piped up

Evan gave him a skeptic eyebrow. It normally took at least two of the Dalmatians to maneuver his massive body into his bed. "Okay...if you say so."

Somehow, Joey was able to get Evan in bed by himself. It took some time and some lifting from awkward positions, but the Dalmatian was able to get the blob to bed. Huffing and panting, he helped Evan pull off the loose grey jumpsuit he was wearing. Evan laid nude in bed watching as Joey shut the curtains of his bedroom.

"Would you, uh, like a blanket, or something?" Joey asked, while seemingly to nervously rub his paws together.

"No thanks. I'm good!"

"Okay, umm...sleep well!" Joey leaned down to shut off the bedside lamp. As he did so, he swiftly move his face over towards Evan. Planting a quick kiss on him, he turned out the light and dashed out the room.

"Woah...uh..." Evan said to himself in the dark. Over the months of getting to know each other, it appeared like the Dalmatian had caught feelings of the obese wolf. He had seen Joey occasionally behave oddly around Evan and being around his crush probably was why. He smirked to himself. "It's good to know my charm still shines through under all this fat..." he thought to himself. But there was a bit of a dilemma of what to do. In a few more months, William will be back and so too will Evan be returned to his normal body. Any sort of relationship between him and Joey would be seriously compromised then. While he certainly would like to take the pup out, if anything became serious, Evan would have to come clean about the situation. Then again, who said he had to date him? He could always keep Joey as a piece on the side. William never said anything about not fooling around with a servant, after all.
12522121.title: True Feelings

125221211.content:
"Well, here's my stop!"

The electric wheelchair squealed to a stop in front of the the bedroom doors.

"That it is!" said Joey. Instead of the usual maroon jumpsuit he wore, the fit Dalmatian was wearing jeans and a t-shirt, both of which showed off his excellent physique. "Thanks for taking me out! I had a really good time!"

The two furs had the typical dinner-and-a-movie date. Or as typical it could be when going out with a gigantic fur. Evan felt a little awkward and self-conscious as he carefully maneuvered his wheelchair around the restaurant, occasionally bumping into tables and having to apologize to the other patrons. But soon, Joey had him feeling relaxed and at ease, laughing as smiling as he devoured all four of his entrees. Afterwards, they went to a nearby theater to watch the latest in the Knives Of Justice series. Luckily, the theater was quite empty so nobody minded it when Evan parked his wheelchair in the aisle. Joey sat in the seat closest, and it was close enough for them to hold paws.

"I had a really good night too!" Evan replied. Joey smiled and the two remained there, struggling to figure out just what to do next. "So, do you want to g-" Evan was cut off as Joey leaned in and gave him a passionate, long kiss. "Eh, wow. You're a good kisser..."

"Heh, thanks," the Dalmatian replied bashfully. "Oh, I think the others are asleep right now. I'll help you get ready for bed..."

***

"You guys can just leave the carts by the bed. I'll take care of things from here."

Joey commanded the other Dalmatians from the bed where he laid next to the enormous wolf. They did just as he said, leaving the carts of food beside the bed before shuffling off. It was strange at first, seeing their coworker snuggling up in bed next their oversized master. But they eventually got used to it, and grew to like how eager Joey was to help Evan alone when it came to things like eating and bathing. This left them with loads of free time that they didn't have before.

"Have fun, Joey," said Jude. "I'm gonna have a smoke break..." He shut the door behind them.

The Dalmatian threw the blanket off of him, revealing his nude sculpted body. Evan watched with lustful eyes as the dog slowly sauntered over to one of the hot trays and grabbed a sausage link. "Hungry, Willy?" Joey asked, dangling the link above Evan's awaiting mouth.

Before he could bite down, the phone on the nightstand started to buzz.

Joey sighed, popping the sausage into his own mouth before handing the phone to Evan.

"Evan! How's it going?" It was still really weird to hear his own voice come through the other end of the line.

"Oh, Wi-...uh, Evan! It's going well, and you?"

"It's going great! Just had lunch in Tokyo! Now I'm off to-" William began prattling on about his trips and everything he's seen and all the places he ate. Bored, Joey climbed atop the obese wolf's body, straddling his legs on either side of Evan's enormous belly, and began rubbing small circles into his lard. This cause Evan to let out a groan. "What was that?" William asked.

"Uh, nothing! Nothing!" Evan replied.

"Anyways, I'll stop boring you now. Oh, can you please arrange a ride for me from the airport next week?" the wolf-now-lion asked.

"A ride for what?"

"From the airport! I'll be back from my trip!"

Evan's heart sank. "Oh...it's, uh, been six months already?"

"Yeah, I know! Time flies! Anyways, a ride, yes?"

"O-okay, yeah. I'll set something up..."

"Wonderful! Ciao for now!" He hung up the phone.

Evan tossed the phone aside onto his large bed and let out a sigh. "What's wrong, Willy?" Joey asked. The lion had totally forgotten that William's trip was coming to an end soon. That meant he'll be back in his own body soon. But sat upon his gigantic belly was a Dalmatian he caught feelings for in his short time posing as the wolf. Evan was unsure what to do. He could tell the truth to Joey, but William might find out he talked about the body swap process and refuse to pay up. And that's even taking into consideration what Joey might say or do. The lion then thought about keeping quiet about the whole thing until the end. He would get his money and...let whatever happen between Joey and William. The actual William.
125221211.title: Date Night

choices: Apply for the desk job as Qual-u-Tech
Reply to the listing from Episteme
13.content:
The laptop hummed away while Evan, munching on a granola bar, browsed on JobDeed, a popular job posting website. He spent much of the day on the site and, lucky for him, found more than a few places that he thought would hire him. While it was true that the lion had enough funds to last him at least a couple of month in the city, Evan decided that it would be better if he found work sooner rather than later. Besides, he reasoned, if he found a job fast, he could use that saved up money on something fun instead of using it for rent.

One posting he qualified for was as a data entry clerk at Qual-U-Tech, a technology firm downtown. By the sounds of the job description, it's a pretty low-key desk job. While Evan didn't quite like the idea of sitting on his butt all day, a cushy desk job was infinitely better than the manual labour jobs he had before.

Another job he believed he could land was at a manufacturing plant working on the assembly line. ManufactCo assembled loads of different machines and parts for other companies, and it sounded like they need a warm body to press the right button at the right time.

Episteme was a research lab that Evan could figure out what exactly they researches. But that didn't matter to him. They were seeking a receptionist, and the lion was sure he knew how to greet people and work a phone line.

Oddly enough, none of the restaurants or resorts for tourists were hiring. The only posting he saw was for a waiter at Zãf, a luxury restaurant. "MUST MEET SPECIFIED PHYSICAL ABILITY AND APPEARANCE REQUIREMENTS" the posting said.

And finally, a local pizza place called Purgatory Pizza was hiring a cook. Evan had previously worked in a similar joint before. And while he wasn't thrilled about the idea of going back to one, he was absolutely certain he'd land the job.
13.title: On the (job) hunt

choices: Bring in a tampered unhealthy lunch
131.content:
The work at Qual-U-Tech was easy enough. Most of Evan's responsibilities revolved around data entry and working with spreadsheets. It only took him a couple of hours before he really got into the swing of things, and soon enough he was crunching numbers like a pro just on his first day.

His stomach growled as Evan walked into the break room to take lunch. The only other fur there was an enormous snow lepard, probably Evan's age, easily past 500 pounds, his button-up shirt clinging to the vast curve of his gut, two chairs were parked underneath each cheek of his bulbous butt. Tufts of white fur peaked out from between overly stressed buttons. The lion gave the snow lepard a nod. He didn't return it, instead taking a massive bite of a burger. It was his third, judging by the wrappers all over the table.

Opening the fridge, Evan went and grabbed for his lunch: A microwave Shepard's Pie he grabbed from the grocery store on his way into work. But it wasn't there. Searching around, he looked for it all throughout the fridge, sure that someone must have moved it around.

"Uh, hey," he asked the snow leopard, "have you seen a..." On the table was the tin pan the pie came in sitting empty beside him. "Uh, I think you might have eaten my lunch..." Evan gestured towards the evidence.

"That thing?" he asked, glancing at the empty tray. "Didn't see you name written on it."

Evan walked over to trash can; the green box the pie came in sat on the top. "Uh, yeah it did." He held up the box. EVAN :) was written in big letter on the top.

The snow leopard shrugged as he swallowed a bit of his burger. "Sucked anyway." He let out an enormous belch before going back to work on his burger.

***

"Don't take it too personally," said the heavy-set panda at the water cooler. "Besides, there's no point fighting him. Toby's dad is a pretty big deal with the company. One call to Daddy Dearest and you'll be given the pink slip."

Evan shook his head as he took a sip of water. "Still, you can't just eat someone else's lunch! That's their property!"

The panda shrugged. "With Toby, it's just easier to find ways to work around him. Pretty much everyone in the office either goes out for lunch or packs something healthy since he won't eat anything green. I do the latter. Not like I'm complaining all that much." He tugged on his pants, showing how loose they were around his thick waist. "Probably dropped 30 pounds thanks to that brat." He drank the last from his water cup before crumpling it and tossing it in the trash can. "Back to the salt mines."

Evan continued to stew in anger over Toby eating his lunch. From what Andrew had just told him, nobody in the office likes Toby or his behavior, yet everyone is too scared to do something. He wasn't going to let that fatty walk all over him.

But as Evan walked back to his cubicle, he began having second thoughts. He needed the job and the money, and picking fights with one of the executive's kids wasn't going to help. Perhaps this was a blessing in disguise. Evan wasn't the best eater, and packing in healthy lunches would not only be more nutritious but also deal with the Toby situation.
131.title: Trouble with Toby

1311.content:
It was nearly the end of the workday for Evan. Needing to relieve himself, he made his way into the men's restroom. The moment he opened the door, he heard a tragic moan from one of the stalls. Toby had been in there since lunch, and the laxative he laced his "lunch" with were still doing their work. As he washed his paws, Toby continued to bellow in agony. Evan smiled as the door shut behind him, though there was a twinge of guilt in the pit of his stomach.

The next day during his lunch break, Evan came into the breakroom with a sackful of burgers from the Burger Barn next door. As usual, Toby was alone and currently devouring a small mountain of burritos.

"Here," Evan said, holding up the sack of burgers up to Toby. "Truce?"

It took the obese snow leopard a minute to put two and two together and realize Evan was the reason he had spent half a workday in the bathroom. He grabbed the bag with a fat paw and looked inside. "Fine. Truce." he muttered. From the bag, he pulled out a couple of greasy cheeseburgers and tossed the bag back to Evan. The lion almost dropped it. "Take the rest," Toby said as he unwrapped a burger. "Looks like you need them more than I do."

Evan shrugged before sitting down at the table with Toby. The two felines ate the rest of their fast food fest in silence.

***

As Evan walked out of the Qual-U-Tech offices one Friday, he tore open his paycheck and was delighted to find that it was much larger than he anticipated. Examining the pay stub, he found that his hourly wages were set much higher than he thought he'd be getting.

"Did my dad, uh, 'fix' your paycheck?" asked Toby as he waddled up to the fox.

"Did he...wait, did you have anything to do with this?" the lion asked Toby, waving the check around.

"Let's say I pulled a few strings. But don't let anyone else know."

"You're secrets good with me!" replied Evan. "Wanna grab a bite to eat? My treat?"

"Heh, sure. But I'll pay more myself," said Toby. "Otherwise I'd eat your whole paycheck away."

Soon, the two felines were at Purgatory Pizza with two enormous pies sitting in front of them. Toby had already demolished nearly an entire pizza on his own. Evan ate quite a bit, though his belly was started to strain the buttons on his shirt. But he had gotten used to that feeling. His frequent fast food lunches with Toby were starting to fill him out. And the lion ventured he put on forty pounds in just a month. This would have worried him had he not been in Port Zaftig. Even if he had several more months like that, he'd still be a wisp of a fur compared to the rest of the town's population. Evan carefully untucked his shirt, giving it a bit more space to accommodate his swelling belly as the lion reached for another slice.

Right when Toby was about to grab the final slice from one of the pizzas, a phone rang. The snow leopard sighed as he fished his phone out from the pocket of his tight dress pants. He glanced at the screen before answering. "What do you want dad?...I'm having dinner with a friend, so I'll take care of it whe-...Yeah, I said a friend...Guy from work...Evan... Administration or something...I mean, I guess." Toby handed the phone over to Evan. "He wants to talk to you."

The lion was caught off guard, quickly swallowed the pizza he was chewing on, and took the phone from Toby. "Hello, uh, hello Mister Toby's Dad?"

The fur on the other end of the line chuckled. "You're a funny one, Evan! You can just call me Edgar. Is my son being truthful? Are you his friend?"

"I suppose so. I don't see why not." Toby wasn't paying attention. Instead, he was starting on the other pizza.

"Yeah. Go out to eat a lot." Toby shoved the last of the burger into his mouth. Ketchup stained his mouth. He wiped it away for going for another burger.

"Uh...feeling hungry?"

"No. But my dad wants to take me to dinner. Probably some salad bar bullshit."

Evan gulped. In the weeks after last seeing Mac, he had totally forgotten about the handshake agreement he made with Toby's father Edgar. The elder fur, the lion reasoned, is probably expecting to see his son at least slightly smaller. Unfortunately, Edgar is going to have dinner with his son at his absolute fattest.

"Well, have fun...and, uh, tell your dad I said hi!"

But Evan wouldn't hear about Toby's dinner with his dad.

The next morning, the lion awake to an email on his phone. NOTICE OF TERMINATION the subject line said. In a panic, Evan quickly skimmed through the email. From what he could make out from all the legalese, he was being fired from Qual-U-Tech for some sort of insubordination, yet it never laid out any specific details. At the end of the email was a signature from a fur he recognized; Edgar had personally signed off on the firing.
13111122112.title: Back on the Fat Train

"Come on, Big Cat! Stretch those spots!"

The fork scrapped against the plastic cake tray as Toby shoveled the last slice of the rich, chocolately cake into his mouth. The snow leopard groaned as he worked his jaws. Reaching for the nearly empty jug of milk on Evan's coffee table, he took a sip before he resumed chewing. Toby swallowed, then let out a burp before tossing the plastic cake tray onto the pile of empty trays.

"Got room for another?" asked Evan, gesturing towards the last vanilla cake sitting on his kitchen countertop.

The snow leopard shook his head as he tugged his shirt back down over the vast white-furred expanse of his belly. The shirt rode right back up a few inches. "Nah. All yours."

Evan invited Toby over to his place one night after work, promising him a surprise. When the obese snow leopard waddled into the lion's apartment, he saw half a dozen cakes waiting for him. "I got kinda bummed out when you said you never got a birthday cake growing up," explained Evan. "Figured I'd help make it up to you! I know it's not eighteen, but the baker only had these many left."

He rejoined Toby on the couch, cake in one paw and fork in the other. "God, that was good..." moaned the snow leopard as a paw lazily rubbed the taunt dome of belly.

"So, what other things did your dad not want you to eat?" asked Evan, digging the fork into the moist cake. "Gotta make up for lost time!"

"Heh, anything that tasted good," replied Toby. "Pizza was might favorite. But I could only get that once or twice a year. That's why I go crazy whenever I have the chance to get it."

The lion swallowed down a hunk of cake. "Well, maybe next time we hang out we'll pick up a lot of pies and you can really go crazy!"

"Oh, really go crazy? How?"

"Just bring your stretchiest pants," Evan said with a wink.

"I like your thinking!" Toby said. "What about you?"

"What about me what?"

"Is there anything that you go crazy for?" the snow leopard asked. "Anything that you just want to really unleash yourself on?"

Evan shrugged. "I dunno. My folks were pretty loose about what I could eat." He took another large forkful of cake and ate it. Just then, an idea popped into his mind. "...oh, I remember something. A while back, Burger Depot has those Bacon Apocalypse burgers. It was only around for a summer before they took it off the menu, but I ate so many that when school rolled around I was up a couple pant sizes!"

Toby chuckled. His jowels jiggled as he did so. "I remember those. Only had one but they were pretty good from what I remember."

"Too bad they discontinued them." Half the cake was resting in Evan's belly.

"Yeah, but I might be able to whip something up. I've been know to make a good burger, and there has to be someone online who tried making them from scratch. The recipe has to be out there somewhere." Toby gave his jumbo-sized gut another few pats. A long, low belch escaped him. "I'll make plenty and we can see just how crazy you can get! The snow leopard winked back.
131112.title: Happy Cake Day x6

1311121.content:
The two felines certainly caused quite the scene at Purgatory Pizza. With a little bit of encouragement from Evan, Toby really cut loose. He ended up demolishing several of the massive pizzas all by himself. And when it came time to finally leave, the snow leopard need a pull from the lion to get himself out of the already spacious booths. Evan, too, made a pig of himself as well. Though he didn't eat anything close to as much as Toby did, the lion filled himself up too the brim. As he waddled out of the restaurant with Toby, his gut stretched his shirt so much that it rode up nearly to the top of the bloated dome. His pants were unbutton and his belly pushed apart the zipper of his jeans nearly all the way to the bottom.

They both crashed at Toby's place since it was closer. Letting himself into his apartment, Toby immediately stripped off his tight shirt and sweatpants, tossing them to a corner of the living room before waddling to the couch. Evan was taken a little off guard by this, and he couldn't help but watch the two hunk of lards that was Toby's butt, which ware barely contained by white briefs that had seen better days, as the two masses shifted around.

Evan's clothes soon joined his.

For the next few hours, the two sat silently watching television. A word wasn't spoken by either of them. Instead, the only noises that could be heard were the churning of their bellies and the occasional loud burp.

"God, I think I really over did it..." moaned Evan, rubbing his still painfully swollen gut.

"Yeah, you don't look so hot. Do you need to lay down a bit?" asked Toby. "You can crash in my bed, if you want. Plenty of room." Evan nodded, and the snow leopard directed him to his bedroom where the lion passed out the moment his head hit the pillow.

The jostling of the mattress as Toby's enormous body crawled into bed was what awoke Evan a few hours later. Rolling over onto his back, he saw the blob of white and grey fur that was the snow leopard despite the bedroom being cast in darkness.

"Oops. Did I wake you up?" he asked.

"Yeah, but don't worry about it. Besides, it's yo-" Evan spotted a box in Toby's paw, but he couldn't tell what it was in the dark. "What's that?"

"Oh? Dessert." he replied. "Ice cream sandwiches. Want one?"

"I dunno...I'm so full, but ice cream does sound really good right now..." Toby shifted his body so that he was laying on his right side. The mattress groaned underneath his weight. He ripped open the box and with his left paw danged a sandwich over his mouth. Evan hesitated for a moment, but opened his mouth anyways. He took a bite, then another bite, then another bite, and soon it was gone. By the time Evan swallowed down the last of the sandwich, Toby had another waiting for him. And Evan ate that one up just the same way, and he did so for the third and fourth.

"Please, no more!" groaned Evan as Toby held another sandwich up for him to eat. "I'm too full...I'll pop if I have another..." The snow leopard smiled before shoving the sandwich into his own mouth whole.

As Evan faded off to sleep due to a second food coma, he felt a paw slowly glide along his stuffed belly. The lion purred. And the last thing he thought before drifting off to sleep was that he hoped the snow leopard did see his throbbing erection in the darkness.
1311121.title: A Really Stuffed Feline

13111211.content:
Toby and Evan developed a bit of a pattern. At first, they would go out to eat then head back to one of their places where the snow leopard would find an excuse to pop a cookie or slice of cake into the lion's mouth. Evan certainly enjoyed it, being feed felt like he was being pampered by Toby. Then their meals stopped happening less at restaurants and more at their apartments. And then it became less about them eating and more about Toby shoveling food down the lion's throat. Now, the two had an established a firm pattern though the two never spoke about it out loud. Toby would invite Evan over for dinner. Evan would agree. A mountain of take-out and an eager snow leopard would be waiting for the lion. He would take his place at the couch where Toby would proceed to feed forkful after forkful to the lion until Evan complained about being too full. They would head to Toby's bedroom where the duo would disrobe and Evan would be treated to belly rubs by the snow leopard. This was always the awkward part. There was no doubt that Toby would tell how "excited" the belly rubs made Evan; the low grunts from Toby told the lion he felt the same. Though nothing ever happened between them. Evan would usually fall asleep before anything could happen, and the lion would slink away in the morning before Toby woke up.

One evening, Evan finally worked up the courage to dust off his scale and see the damage he was doing to his body. The scale read 302.

"Oof..." he groaned, grabbing his sizable gut with both paws and giving it a firm shake. The ball of lard jiggled violently around. Evan didn't have the hard kind of gut he's seen on some beer-loving furs but rather doughy, buttery fat that sunk easily under his paws. He pinched the roll of fat growing atop his gut. Some more pounds and it'll blow out into a distinct roll, dividing his belly from his moobs. His moobs. He cupped them with this paws. His ex-girlfriend was kinda busty, but the tits Evan were sprouting might be just as big as her's. Waddling his naked body over to his full-length mirror, he turned and glanced over his shoulder. Lifting his tail to properly see his rear, he was shocked to see two basketball-sized blobs of fat dimpled with cellulite and with two saddles of lard resting on top, his lovehandles, and thighs coated in pillowly fat. Slapping a cheek, the dual masses wobbled around like jelly. Turning around to face the mirror, Evan lifted up his gut slightly to check out his manhood. A pad of fat was being to swallow up his cock. It was hard to tell in its deflated state, but he judged that it might have lost an inch and a half of length.

He continued checking his enlarged body out in the mirror slightly. The silence was only broken when he finally uttered...
