132.content:
A chunky panda sat across the desk from Evan. His heavy chest and gut strained the buttons on his shirt. Tufts of black and white fur peaked out. This certainly want the first obese fur Evan encountered today. On his way to the interview with ManufactCo, nearly all furs he saw were overweight in some capacity. This panda wasn't even the bigger he saw today.

"Alright, everything looks good here," Mr. Tafts, the panda and supervisor at ManufactCo said as he eyes Evan's resume one more time. The lion felt like he absolutely nailed the interviewed. "And once again, thanks for coming down on such short notice."

"Oh, it's no problem!" Evan replied. He had sent his application in the evening before and was called up by Mr. Tufts that next morning to see if he could come in for an interview that same day.

"So...you're reliable, got a solid work history, no manufacturing experience but that's okay. We can train you on the job. I think you'll be a good fit! Welcome aboard!" The panda stuck out a meaty paw. Evan reached out and shook it.

"Great!" the lion said. "So, uh, what exactly will I be doing?"

"We have a couple of manufacturing lines that need help. One of our lines produces all sorts of pipes and tubes. These go mainly to the Go-Yum food processing plant a few towns over. Another line puts together air compressor units for factories and shops. And then I have some guys assembling refrigerator units for restaurants and the like."

"Wow," Evan said. "That's a lot of different stuff."

"Yep," Me. Tafts replied. "Our speciality is that we don't specialize in anything. It gives us to flexibility to work for a whole host of industries. Now, all those line need help. I'll like you pick whichever one you want. They all pay the same and work the same hours. So, what stands out to you?"
132.title: A member of ManufactCo

choices: Break into the lab's protected files
133.content:
It had been a week since Evan landed the job at Episteme. He absolutely nailed the interview and was pretty much offered the job on the spot. And the lion was enjoying the gig. It was pretty low-key. He sat at the front desk of the Episteme Labs building in downtown Port Zaftig where he received and transfered calls, directed guests and research participates where they needed to go, and did some basic paperwork. At first, Evan didn't look forward to the idea of a desk job. But the comfy extra-wide chair they provided certainly helped.

The only downside of the job that Evan saw were the dress requirements. Business causal, he had been told. Luckily, the lion brought with him a nice button-up shirt that did the job though now it was starting to strain against his nearly permanently bloated stomach. Evan had gone out to eat for almost every meal. Not only did he want to try out the city's many, many restaurants, but also eating out was dirt cheap. Besides, Evan reasoned, he can cut loose a little. This is a new city and he landed a posh new job, so he deserved to treat himself.

That afternoon, a fur came into Episteme Labs. Starting around 5'10", the mouse had grey fur from head to toe. He wore pretty non-descript clothes: A black t-shirt and blue jeans. What stood out to Evan about the mouse was that he was thin, exceptionally thin. Evan was starting to notice that the general population of Port Zaftig was fairly fat, but the mouse was even thinner than Evan. His cheeks were sunken, his chest and abdomen flat as a board, and he had boney arms and legs.

The mouse nervously approached the counter. "Uh, hi," he said timidly. "I'm here to see...umm..." He searched his pockets for a piece of paper and pulled out a folded up page with printed texted on it. "Doctor... Kirkpatrick? Emil Kirkpatrick?"

Emil Kirkpatrick was, from what Evan heard in the breakroom, one of the top researchers for Episteme Labs. However, the lion had no clue what sorts of things he researched. Even searching online brought up nothing substantial. All Evan knew was that he had a PhD in molecular biology and that was pretty much it.

But what was strange about this was that Dr. Kirkpatrick never actually dealt with other furs. He had dozens and dozens of furs working under him. So he never handled any small business that a lab assistant could handle. The mouse saying he had an appointment with specifically with the doctor was certainly an anomaly.

What was a greater anomaly was Dr. Kirkpatrick coming down in person collect his visitor. "You're late," he said impatiently to the mouse. Dr. Kirkpatrick was a older brown bear nearly six and a half feet tall. He had arms and legs thick with muscle that were visible through his tight shirt and slacks. An impressive gut stuck out far in front on him, pressuring the buttons on his shirts and forcing him to always leave his lab coat open.

"I'm sorry, sir," the mouse stammered. "But the airport lost my luggage and taxi driver got l-"

"Enough. Come. The procedure room has been prepped for some time." The mouse followed the doctor into the elevator, and the two disappeared.

It was only when evening arrived that Evan saw the mouse again. As the elevator doors opened, he quickly walked through the lobby desperately trying not to make eye contact with anyone. His cheeks blushed bright red. The lion immediately noticed the incredible mass that was now the mouse's belly. Looking nearly nine months pregnant, his belly stuck out nearly a foot and a half in front of him and shook with every hurried step. The mouse tried pulling his shirt down, but it wouldn't even cover a third of his grey-furred gut. His jeans were now unbuttoned and being held up by his other paw.

Evan was dumbfounded at what he saw, at what had changed so drastically about the mouse who was now exiting the building. The lion was extremely curious about what procedure Dr. Kirkpatrick had done and wanted to know more about what the doctor was up to. Being a reception, Evan had little access to files from any of the researchers. However, he did have access to some basic files about any of the lab's clientele. There may be some clues about the mouse there. If he was willing to be more risky, he could "borrow" a terminal access card. Researchers used these cards to get past all of the security measures used to protect their research, and Dr. Kirkpatrick must have something behind the firewalls, though if he got caught Evan would most certainly be fired.

Or if he acted quick, he could tail the mouse before he got too far away. His shift was up and the lion was ready to leave anyway. Following the mouse might reveal something about what procedure he just went through.

First, that his file specifically stated that he needed to report to and only to Dr. Kirkpatrick. It was strange that the Doctor himself would come down to collect a patient. But it was even stranger that the mouse was only seeing Dr Kirkpatrick. This, Evan reasoned, meant that the Doctor was working solo on this patient which at Episteme Labs was pretty much unheard of. And second, whatever the mouse came in for, it was for a cosmetic procedure. The Lab sometimes did kinds of cosmetic projects, so that isn't too out of the ordinary. But the mouse spent all day there and left looking absolutely massive. So what kind of cosmetic procedure makes someone has an incredibly engorged belly afterwards?

Looking up Ethan's patient profile raised more questions than it answered. It wasn't too late in the evening, so if Evan felt adventurous, he could sneak into some of the more protected files if he managed to find an access cards. But then again, he might not want to push his luck. It looks like the mouse will be in tomorrow too. So he could find out a bit more then.

1333.title: On His Tail

13331.content:
After some time, the mouse finally left the bathroom with a satisfied look on his face and a towel wrapped around his waist. As he made his way over to the motel room bed, his doughy and spherical belly happily bounced along with each step. Siting on the edge of the bed which faced the window and door, the mouse took a minute to examine the belly which was now taking up much of his lap. Slipping two paws underneath, he lifted it up a few inches before letting it drop. The mass shook and quaked. The mouse did this again a few more time. He grabbed the sides his belly and started shaking it. As his gut jiggled wildly, a look of pure excitement across his face. That is, until it was replaced by a look of shock. He spotted the lion spying on him through the window.

"Shit..." Evan muttered to himself. He thought about running but before he could escape the mouse already had his head sticking out of the doorway.

"What are you doing? Were you spying on me?" The mouse asked, his voice a mix of anger and fear.

"I'm sorry! I saw you leave the labs and you looked sorts off so I-"

"Wait, you're from the labs?" The mouse said, cutting Evan off. "Uh, come on in..."

He beckoned Evan into the motel room. Soon, the two were sat on the bed as Evan explained everything. Everything except for seeing the mouse pleasure himself. He wanted to spare the fur the embarrassment of that. He tried not staring at the blob of a belly resting in the mouse's lap.

"So, yeah, that why I followed you here. I'm sorry, but I really did have the best intentions," the lion apologized.

"It's...it's okay," the mouse said. "I just I was just kinda freaked out that Dr. Kirkpatrick sent a spy after me or something. He seems really adamant about keep this all a secret."

Evan shrugged his shoulders. "Alright if you say so...uh, I don't think I got your name."

The mouse stuck out a paw. "It's Jamie."

***

Evan sat at his desk in the reception area of Episteme Labs when Jamie came in as he done for the past two weeks. Like usual, he left the night before looking like his belly was going to pop, and like usual he arrived looking skinny as a stick. But rather than going straight to the elevator as he has always done, Jamie walked right up to Evan's desk.

"Oh, hey Jamie, how are y-"

"Excuse me, sir," he said sternly with a worried expression on his face as he lended his whole body over the desk. "Can you tell me if the elevator is working?" From his paw, a crumpled up piece of paper fell onto Evan's desk. The mouse's eyes briefly darted towards.

"Uh...yeah, it is. Go right in."

Jamie quickly walked over to the elevator, mashed a button, and disappeared inside. Evan snatched up the piece of crumpled paper of his desk and smoothed it out. A message was written on it.

MY MOTEL ROOM TONIGHT AT 10PM PLEAE COME
13331.title: Super Spy

13332.content:
The mouse showed up bright and early the next morning. Evan immediately noticed that the fur's formerly flabby belly was now back to its originally flat state. The lion tried not to blush thinking about how he accidentally spied on the mouse pleasuring himself the previous night.

"Hello and welcome t-"

"Um, I know where to go," the mouse said meekly. He hurried he way to the elevator and mashed the buttons, disappearing inside once the doors opened.

The rest of Evan's day was remarkably dull. He answered phones, set up appointments, responded to emails, and overate during lunch. There was a special at the nearby Burger Barn and the lion just couldn't pass it up. That afternoon his overstuffed belly pressed hard against the buttons on his white button-up shirt.

It wasn't until nearly the end of his shift that Evan thought about that mouse again. He hadn't seen him leave the building. Perhaps the mouse left during his lunch break, or perhaps he exited through some other door.

Minutes before Evan was slated to leave, the elevator dinged once more. Out walked the mouse. Just like the night before, his flat abdomen had ballooned out massively into jiggling, wobbling mass. The lion stared as the mouse as he made his way to the door. Evan swore that he was even bigger than the day before. The mouse's steps were awkward and disjointed. Clearly, he wasn't used to waddling around with the new weight, and it also didn't help that his gut was sloshing around uncontrollably. Before he could reach the door, the mouse took a tumble. He hit the ground hard and his belly jiggled violently.

Evan quickly rushed over to him. "Oh my God, are you only?" The mouse was struggling to get up, and seeing this the lion helped him back onto his feet. The fur stumbled a bit, knocking into Evan, who instinctively held out his paws to catch the mouse. One paw caught his belly and easily sunk into the flesh. It was incredibly soft and supple and warm. It reminded Evan of marshmallow fluff.

"I'm-I'm fine...," the mouse said. He started pulling away from Evan but the lion dragged him back closer to him. The mouse's grey-furred gut smacked into Evan.

"Dude, this is the second time I've seen you walk out of here big as a house!" Evan said in a hushed whisper. "What the hell is going on?"

The mouse stammered. "I...I can't tell you...Mister...Dr. Kirkpatrick told me not to tell anyone! He said if I talk then the military will cancel the co-" He suddenly brought a paw up to his mouth and gasped. "I shouldn't have said that! Forget I said anything!" He broke away from Evan and rushed out the door and down the street, his huge gut bouncing up and down as he moved.

***

The mouse didn't come in the next morning, and Evan's morning was just as lackluster as it was the day before. That is, until a chunky ferret taped him on the shoulder.

"Evan? I'm supposed to fill in for you," she said.

"Wait, why? For what?" he asked.

"Dunno. HR just called me down. I'm just as-"

Suddenly, the phone rang. Evan picked it up ready to deliver the standard greeting. "Thank you for callin-"

"Evan. Please report to my office," Dr. Kirkpatrick said. "Now."
13332.title: Secrets Secrets are no fun

133321.content:
The burly bear stared daggers at Evan from over his glasses. Dr. Kirkpatrick was an imposing fur. His white lab coat was ill-fitting; his biceps threatened to explode out of the sleeves. "And that's it? That's all that he told you?"

"Y-yes, sir" Evan said nervously. "Where, uh, where is..."

"Jamie? I asked him to come in late today." He glanced at the thick watch around his wrist. "Actually, he should be..." A couple of quick knocks were heard in the office. "Come in," the bear barked. In walked the grey mouse. Once again he was skinny as a rail, deflated back to his former state. As Jamie took a seat next to Evan, he tried not making eye contact with the lion.

"Any change?" the doctor asked.

"No, sir."

"Let's see, then." The mouse gave a quick glance over to Evan. "Now." Jamie quickly stripped down to his boxers, showing off his incredibly skinny body. There wasn't an ounce of fat on him. Dr. Kirkpatrick examined Jamie's body from behind the desk. The mouse turned around when ordered to. Evan could see his cheeks blush bright red with embarrassment. "Okay, sit down." Jamie quickly dressed himself and sat back down in his chair.

"Can I...can I get back to work now?" asked Evan.

"No. Because you're now in on this," the bear replied. "If you know a little bit of the secret, you know a lot of the secret."

"Secret? What secret?"

Dr. Kirkpatrick cleared his throat. "I managed to secure a rather lucrative contract with the military. Unfortunately, it was a contract the shareholders and the ethics boards disapproved of. So I'm keeping this a secret between me, you, and Jamie. Nobody else is going to know. Nobody else will know. Now, Evan, did you know how strategically important the Artic and Antarctic are? Very. However, those are both incredibly inhospitable environments. But animals still live there, don't they, Evan?"

"Yeah. Like, walruses do, I think."

Dr. Kirkpatrick smiled. "Yes, Evan. Walruses do live there. And how do you think they keep warm in such cold weather?"

"Uh...blubber?"

"Yes, Evan. Now, imagine we took a solider and coated him with blubber. He surely ought to be able to survive the cold, yes? But how do actually do that? Feeding him cookies and cakes and such is slow and unhealthy. But were there a way to fill a fur with blubber temporarily or semi-permanently, that would be so much better. And that's what Jamie and I have been working on."

"So, Jamie's being pumped with a load of blubber?" asked Evan.

"A synthetic kind, but yet. Unfortunately, the formula isn't quite right. The effects disappear too soon, hence when he's in the state he's in now."

Evan turned to the mouse. "But why are you doing this? What do you get out of it?"

"Oh, uh," stuttered Jamie. "I get a bit of money and, uh..."

"And," cut in Dr. Kirkpatrick, "once I figured out a permanent formula of my synthetic blubber, Jamie will be pumped full of it. As much as his heart desires! Isn't that we agree on, hmm?" The mouse shyly nodded. The bear turned to Evan. "The poor boy has, um, huge ambitions. If he didn't have the metabolism of a hummingbird, I reason he'd be twice the size of even the biggest fur this city has to offer!" Jamie sunk down in his chair with embarrassment.

"Okay, but why tell me all this? What does this have to do with me now?"

"Because I just acquired a new test subject."

"Oh...oh, no! I'm not doing this! Are you crazy? Pumping me full of some weird stuff? Hell no!"

The doctor chuckled. "Calm down, son. The effects will be temporary. And I assure you you will be rewarded handsomely for your participation. I don't want to give everything away, but you'll be able to retire very young afterwards."

"So? I don't care! You can't force me to be a lab rat!"

"The procedure isn't harmful, quite pleasant actually. Isn't that right, Jamie?" The mouse nodded. "I don't see why you're so adamantly against this. I'd take this agreement in a heartbeat if I were you! But then again, I'm not giving you much of a choice, Evan. I hate sounding so cliche, but I'm making you an offer you can't refuse."
133321.title: In Dr. Kirkpatrick's Office

1333211.content:
"Wait! Hold the elevator!"

Jamie stuck a paw between the doors, forcing them open. Evan rushed in, his baggy shirt waving around as he ran. The mouse pressed the button, the doors shut, and the elevator was on its way up.

Though the two had warmed up to each other a bit over the two weeks they were having the procedure done to them, things were still pretty awkward given the surreal situation they were in.

Evan glanced at Jamie's body, looking for any noticable changes, to see if anything "stuck". Nothing. The guy was as skinny as the first day he entered the labs. "So, uh, notice anything new this time?" he asked.

"No. Nothing," replied the mouse.

"...uh, you've been getting any side effects at all?"

"No. Get kinda gassy, but that's all."

"Heh, me too."

The night before, both boys waddled out of the Episteme Labs build with massive, wobbling bellies filled with gallons of Dr. Kirkpatrick's synthetic blubber. Both boys had cartoonishly oversized bellies that, in any other city, would have made them stick out like a sore thumb. In Port Zaftig, however, they fit right in. At first, Evan felt strange leaving the labs each night with a belly that made him look overdue with triplets. Yet the lion eventually warmed up to it. 141.content:
The only light in the living room when Evan woke up from his impromptu nap came from the glow of the television. It was pitch black outside; dusk had came many hours before. The lion groggily searched for his phone and found it under the empty pizza box. It read 1:04am.

The lion yawned and stretched. His stomach, which still quite full, was no longer get filled to the point of discomfort. He lazily rubbed a paw along the still distended midsection. Evan sat up and tried working a kink out in his back. Although the couch was comfortable to sit on, it clearly wasn't designed for naps. The rest of the night should be spent in bed.

The lion dug out the remote control from between the cushions of the couch. Playing on television was an infomercial for some kitchen gadget.

"It slices! It dices! It chops! It rocks!" the rotund pachyderm on TV said holding up what looked to be a standard kitchen knife.

Evan shrugged and pointed the remote at the screen. Before he could turn the set off, the screen turned bright white, blinding the lion momentarily. When his eyes adjusted, he saw three words in a black simple font fill the screen.

YOU'VE BEEN CHOSEN.

The second Evan read the words they disappeared off the screen, and the television shut off on its own.

The lion was spooked. He wasn't sure what he had seen, if it was even real. Was he the victim of an elaborate prank? Evan took a moment to collect himself before pushing this out of his mind. He had been pretty sleep deprived from the long road trip to Port Zaftig and what he saw was surely a figment of an overactive imagination.

That illusion, however, was shattered the next morning. He had gotten ready for the day and was about to leave his apartment to find a local coffee place when he saw that someone had slipped a bright yellow envelope under the crack of his front door.

NIGHTINGALE PARK
FAR SIDE OF THE LAKE BETWEEN THE BOULDERS
10:35PM TONIGHT
TELL NO ONE
BRING NO ONE

That was what the card, the only contents of the envelope, said.

Evan was now legitimately worried. Who was reaching out to him? What could they possibly want with him? The lion just got to town. How could someone be after him now? The lion thought about calling the police. Maybe they've dealt with something like this before. Or he could just ignore this altogether, pretend nothing. But deep down, Evan was curious. What did they want?
141.title: YOU'VE BEEN CHOSEN

1411.content:
"We told you not to tell anyone."

Evan was sitting in the back of a police car parked in a lot across from Zãf, a gourmet restaurant in the tourism district of Port Zaftig. As soon as Evan saw the note, he called the police. Moments later, a hulking gorilla knocked on the door. The beast was close to seven feet tall and his body was a mass of muscle. Pecs and biceps strained his uniform, quads threatened to burst out of his pants. The lion explained the note and the weird message from last night to the gorilla who looked indifferent. "We should take you downtown to the station," the gorilla suggested. "If someone is stalking you, it's not safe to stay here."

The lion sat quietly in the back of the cop car as the gorilla silently drove through town. His massive body nearly took up the entire front end of the car. Although Evan didn't know where the police department was, he got the feeling it wasn't located in the city's tourism district. But the menacing demeanor of the gorilla kept Evan from saying anything until they reached that parking lot and the gorilla spoke.

"Wha...what are you talking about? And I thought we were going to the station!" Evan said.

"We told you not to tell anyone," the gorilla repeated.

"We? Who are you? What's your name and badge number, Officer?"

The beast chuckled, looking down at his uniform as if he forgot what he was wearing. "Name's Wrath," he spoke. "And I'm not a cop. The opposite, actually." The gorilla wasn't even looking at Evan as he spoke.

The lion reached for the door handle and pulled. It was locked. "What the hell do you want?" yelled Evan.

"You've been chosen."

"Chosen for what?"

The gorilla looked over his right shoulder slightly. "The Seven Sins Society."

"The what?" Evan was baffled. He had never heard of such a thing.

The gorilla resumed looking straight ahead. "This city is evil. Full of evil. You might not be able to tell, but it is. Crooks, cowards, drunkards and gamblers. Port Zaftig is home to no saint." The gorilla paused; Evan said nothing. "The Society takes advantage of this. If a fur is evil deep down, why not cash in on it? Why not make a profit?"

"What do you want from me?" The lion asked quietly.

"You've been chosen. We need an Accolade. Each Sin has its Accolade, and that Accolade serves as an exemplar for that Sin, sees that Sin in others, corrurpts others and haresses their Sin to acquire power and money. I'm the Accolade of Wrath. I bring furs into the underground fighting circuits, run protection rackets, whip up a riot when need be, and the like. And there are others who are equally skilled at exploiting a fur's darker nature. Lust has every prostitute in her pocket, Pride has every politician in his own. And we Accolades reap the rewards of the Sins others."

"...I still don't see what this has to do with me," the lion said.

The gorilla let out a heavy sigh. "We need a new Accolade of Greed. The previous Accolade met with an...explosive end. And you've been chosen. This city hasn't corrupted you yet. You're going to be the new Accolade of Greed."

"Like hell I am!" Evan shot back. "I don't want to be a part of your cult gang thing!"

The gorilla in the front of the police car let you a loud holw of laughter. "You have much less choice in that matter than you think! Now, enough talk. We need to see how greedy our new Greed can get." He extended a thick finger in the direction of the restaurant. "Zãf. Ever been? Heard it's good." The lion heard a loud click; the car's door were unlocked. "Why don't you check it out? I think you habe a reservation."

Evan quickly opened his door and got out. The moment he slammed it shut, the police car sped away and disappeared amongst the rest of traffic.
1411.title: Greed

14112.content:
Red and blue lights flashed in Evan's review mirror moments before the police car's siren sounded. He knew that it was him they wanted to pull over; his was the only car on the road. The lion pulled over and parked his car. Bashing his head against the steering wheel a few times, Evan chewed himself out for speeding.

But he knew he was speeding. The lion was trying to get out of town as fast as he could.

When Wrath let him out in that parking lot earlier in the day, Evan flagged down a taxi. The moment he got home, the lion began packing a bag. He wasn't sure if he was going to be gone a few days or few weeks, so he just threw into a duffle bag what he felt were essentials. In less than an hour, the lion was back on the road. Destination? No place in particular. Anywhere where he couldn't be found by them.

The lion pulled out his license and registration. The officer was taking his sweet time getting out of the cop car. Evan was getting impatient. Each second parked was one less second spent getting as far away from Port Zaftig as possible.

The blood in the lion's body froze when an impossibly muscular gorilla hauled itself out of the car. It was Wrath. Panicked, Evan ignited the engine. The gorilla was mere inches away from the car when the lion slammed on the gas pedal. Rubber burned as the car peeled out back onto the road. He checked the rearview mirror again. The gorillas was standing there, watching as Evan sped away.

Maybe his vacation from Port Zaftig would be a bit more permanent.
14112.title: Need for Speed

1412.content:
At 10:36pm, a loud knock came from Evan's apartment door.

The lion was just about to head to bed and was only wearing a pair of grey shorts which hung loosely from his slender frame. He didn't know who could be knocking at this hour. Glancing through the peephole, Evan couldn't make out anything. Something was blocking his view.

"Curiousity killed the cat," Evan muttered as he opened the door. A fur holding a tall stack of white boxes came charging through the open door.

"Delivery!" the fur yelled as they passed Evan. The lion was caught off guard as the stranger rushed to set the stack on his kitchen.

"What the hell? I didn't order anyth-" The lion watched as the fur, a rabbit an inch taller than him, take off his white cap and shake loose his lush, golden shoulder length hair. Evan was taken aback by the sheer beauty of this fur. Easily, this was one of the prettiest rabbits he had ever seen, with a handsome face and silky smooth off-white fur. It took the lion a moment before he tore his eyes away from the gorgeous bunny who was now fixing his hair using his cellphone camera. "Like I was saying, I didn't order anything! You've got the wrong address or something."

"Nope, this is the right place." The rabbit wasn't even looking at Evan while he talked as he was far too focused on getting his wavy hair just right. "After all, you've been chosen."

"I've been...wait, who are you? And what the hell do you want?"

The rabbit walked passed Evan who caught a whiff of the fur's flowery perfume. He shut the door and then started unbuttoning his white shirt. "Don't want to give anyone a free show!" In a matter of seconds, the rabbit was clad only in white y-front briefs, his uniform tossed onto the ground. The bunny looked like he was carved out of marble. Cut six-pack abs, rippling muscles, defined quads, and a round yet firm rear. He didn't have an ounce of fat on him. Once more, Evan was entranced by the beauty of the creature as he casually strolled over to the boxes and unstacked them. Each was stamped with a logo from Heavenly Bakery. It was the same logo that was on shirt that now laid on the floor. "Ah, much better. I hate having to put on a costume. Anyways, as I was saying, you've been chosen."

"Chosen for what?" asked Evan as he watched the hunky fur open up the boxes. Cakes, cookies, and numerous other kinds of baked goods filled each box.

"For the Seven Sins Society." The lion was silent. "Never heard of us, have you? That's good. We like to be secretive. The Society believes that deep down, every fur is a bit evil. That every fur has a sin. And that sin, we believe, can be exploited. In the Society, every sin has an Accolade, and that Accolade's responsibility is to kind of serve as an ideal for that sin. This draws in furs who are naturally attracted to that kind of sin. The Accolade then manipulates them to their will and uses them and their sin for the benefit of the Society as a whole. I am Pride. And I've got pretty much every political leaders in this city in my pocket. Little do they know they they're all in some way, shape, or form working for the Society's ends. All I need to do with stroke their ego, in a way."

"...what do you want with me?" Evan asked quietly. The rabbit approached the lion and wrapped a muscled arm around his shoulder as they walked towards the living room couch. He was enamored by the rabbit and hoped that what was stirring to life in his shorts wouldn't be noticable.

"Sloth recently met with a tragic end," Pride said as the bunny sat Evan down on the couch. "What a shame, too. Nice enough guy if you could stand the smell. And he got plenty of work done. You wouldn't have guessed it knowing he rarely left his bed. But when he went, so did all of his Acolytes. They worked for him and only through him. Now we need to rebuild that network, and to do that, we need a new Sloth. And you'd be perfect. You haven't been corrupted by this city yet. We've been watching. The Society has eyes and ears in places you'd never expect eye and ears to be. So you can be crafted into the new Accolade for Sloth."

"What? I don't want to work for your group! You're evil! You exploit furs! And what do you mean you want me to be Sloth?" Evan asked pointedly.

The rabbit stiffled a laugh. "You don't really have much of a choice in the matter. You've been chosen, remember?"

"Chosen by who? By what?"

The pretty bunny hushed Evan. "That's enough questions for now. We've got to get you ready to fill in you're new role as the Accolade of Sloth." The rabbit grabbed a box from the kitchen counter and sat on the coffee table across from the lion. He grabbed a sugar-covered doughnut from the box and held it up to Evan's mouth. "Open up, Sloth," Pride said with a smirk on his face.
1412.title: Sloth

14121.content:
Crumbs and icing covered Evan's mouth, chest, and now swollen belly busily digesting tens of thousands of calories in carbs and sugar when he awoke the next afternoon. The lion groaned as he gently rubbed a paw against the mass that was now his stomach. It was heavily distended and made him look as if he was several months pregnant. Taking in his surroundings, he saw empty white boxes stern about his living room; the contents of them all were now resting in the lion's gut.

Evan found his grey shorts laying on one of the arms of couch. On top of them were the y-fronts the bunny wore the night before who was nowhere to be found. Glancing towards the door, the lion saw that the bunny's clothes were gone; the fur must have left some time ago. The lion picked up the briefs and raised them to his nose, taking a deep breath in. The lingering musk of the beautiful rabbit instantly aroused the lion who began pleasuring himself as he inhaled more and more of the rabbit's scent. Evan couldn't be bothered to get up and grab a tissue, so he erupted all over himself adding more to his messy fur. The lion began reaching for his shorts to wipe himself off, but he felt lazy and worn out from getting himself off. Instead, he grabbed for the remote and turned on the television. "It'll dry out anyways," he said to himself.

Hours later, he stomach had deflated considerable. The lion hadn't left the couch all day; the feeding last night left him too lethargic to do anything. But Evan was feeling like he needed a real meal in him. Grabbing his phone, he found a cheap Mexican place nearby, El Diablito Burrito, and placed an order.

The pudgy raccoon delivering Evan his meal had to hide his look of disgust as he watched the lion sign the credit card receipt. The lion finally managed to put on a pair of shorts, but hadn't bothered to do much else. Glaze icing from the night before was still stuck to one of his cheeks. Taking the bags from the raccoon, Evan lazily walked back to the couch and set his meal on the table brushing aside the white boxes. He had ordered two very large burritos as well as plenty of rice and beans. The lion pulled off his shorts once more, sat himself down again, and began devouring his meal. Soon enough, his belly was just as bloated as it was before if not more so. Globs of cheese and rice now stuck to the lion's yellow and cream colored fur. It was getting dark outside, and the lion drifted off to sleep in front of the television.

For an entire week, that was just how Evan spent his day. He'd wake up, order food, stuff himself full, fall, asleep, and wake up only to devour more food. The lion rarely left his couch each to go to the bathroom or answer the door for his delivery. He couldn't even be bothered to get himself cleaned up. The apartment reeked of his musk and flatulence, his fur was matted down and greasy. And the most exercise he got was getting himself off several times a day.

Sitting on his butt and stuffing himself full was having an impact on his waistline. His flat abdomen had ballooned out into a sizable gut that rested on his lap. Though soft and jiggly, it typically was so full and took on the appearance of a basketball. His chest was puffing up into two mounds of fat, Evan's nipples widened a bit. And the lion's rear was getting pudgier and rounder (not like get noticed, though).

One morning, the lion woke up on the couch. Scratching his belly, he reached for his phone to look up some photos of hot furs to pleasure himself to. Evan saw the date and realized that it was well past a week since he came to Port Zaftig. But in that time, all he did was eat and sit on the couch. The lion justified it to himself as a kind of stay-cation, and that he deserved a break from the multi-day road trip it took him to get into town. Yet he felt like he need to get off his butt and get out of the apartment, if he could be bothered to.
14121.title: Lazy Cat

14122.content:
"I should have take him seriously," said Evan, he voice echoing in the bare jail cell.

The lion forced the beautiful bunny out the door that fateful evening. Shoving him out into the hallway of his apartment building, Evan didn't even give Pride the opportunity to grab the clothes he came in with. The bunny tried to overpower the lion, but he was ultimately able to oust the rabbit.

"You'll regret this!" Pride shouted from the hall as Evan slammed the door closed. "I know powerful people!"

The next morning, a squad of beefy police officers stormed Evan's apartment. The lion was in a state of confusion as they cuffed him, saying something about bank fraud and conspiracies and obstruction. He was whisked away as officers tore apart him apartment. The lion passed by a couple officers carrying up boxes of documents in the direction of his apartment on his way out. In less than an hour, Evan was processed booked into the city jail.

He was promised a speedy trail, and he got one. The jury came back with a guilty verdict in less than twenty minutes. His lawyer expected as much.

"This case is airtight!" the lawyer had told Evan. "It's a paper case against you! All anyone needs to do is look at your banking documents and they'll know you did it!"

"But I didn't do anything!" pleaded Evan. "This whole case was made up! All of this is fake!"

Nevertheless, he was found guilty of the trumped up charges and currently awaited sentencing. Ten years, if the judge is kind.

Maybe he should have taken Pride seriously.
14122.title: Pride and Prejudice

1413.content:
"You've been chosen."

Evan had been checking his phone. The clock just turned over to 10:35pm when he heard the silky, sultry voice from the shadows. The lion looked around to find the source of voice amongst the trees and rocks that lined the lake of Nightingale Park. From around a boulder appeared a mink. She was around the same height as Evan and had an incredible hourglass shape to her body that even the lion could make out in the dark. The light of the moon shined off her light brown fur as she slowly approached Evan. She was wearing a tight leather bodysuit that softly creaked as her chest and butt bounced up and down with every step.

"Chosen for what?" asked Evan while trying not to obviously check her generous proportions out.

"For the Seven Sin Society," she said. She leaned against a tree, sticking out her wide hips. "Our people have been watching you for some time now."

"How? And what's this Seven Sin Society?"

"We've got eyes everywhere. The Society has a basic principle at its core: Every fur has a bit of sin in them. We cash in on that idea. We find what lies within a fur and exploit it. Well, maybe exploit isn't the right word. We 'cultivate' that sin, let them bring it out. Let them live with it. And the Society is there is skim a little off the top. I'm Lust, and I use a fur's darker sexual desires for our benefit. Every pimp and prostitute in this town pays a little out to me, for example. Hell, I practically recruited every single one of them."

"So, what do you want with me?" asked Evan nervously. "I don't want to be a hooker or something."

The mink laughed out loud. "Oh no, we have different plans for you. You see, for every sin we have an Accolade. That Accolade functions both as embodiment of that sin as well as a means to attract and recruit furs to do our bidding." She starting walking towards Evan, her hips swaying left and right as she walked. The lion took a couple of steps back but found himself with his back against a tree. Lust pressed her body against his, her busty chest flattening against him. "We lost our Accolade of Gluttony. The poor boy, so young. When we he went, we lost all of the Acolytes that served him. They only worked for him and through him, so we need that network rebuilt. And now we want you to fill his big, big role."

"But...but I don't want to join some sort of criminal gang!" Evan stammered. The mink laughed, taking one of his paws and placing it on her plump backside.

"Oh, please, baby?" she pouted. "We can have so, so much fun together."

"I...this is...I just..."

The mink smirked as she produced a vial from a pocket in her suit. It contained a luminescent red substance. "Here, sweetie," she said unscrewing the cap. "I've got a little something that should make you feel more the part of the Accolade of Gluttony you were meant to be." She raised the vial up to Evan's mouth. "Drink up!"
1413.title: Gluttony

14131.content:
"Hey mister! Are you okay?"

Evan's eyes slowly opened, adjusting to the bright sun hanging in the sky. The lion took a second to take in his surroundings. He was lying on the ground, a green grassy field. Looking around, the lion recognized that he was in Nightingale Park. Two chunky cubs were standing over him.

"Yeah, yeah. I'm okay..." Evan said, picking himself off the ground. The lion brushed himself off. While he was still wearing the clothes he had on last night, they were all disheveled.

"See! Told ya he was alive!" one cub said to the other. "Race you to the swings!"

As Evan wandered out of the park, he tried to recollect what happened the night before. He remembered walking to the park, but he couldn't remember why he was there or what had happened. The only thing that stuck in his mind was the image of a vial of luminescent red fluid and nothing else.

On his way back to his apartment, the lion passed by El Burrito Diablito. Though he was in a state, Evan realized that he didn't eat much the day before. His stomach growled in protest. Shrugging, he stepped inside to pick up a taco or two.

"I'll have six bean burritos, five tacos, two Mexican pizzas, four sides of rice and three quesadillas."

Evan was shocked. Standing at the front counter of the restaurant, the lion planned on only getting a snack. Yet when he went to make his order, those words just blurted out of him with no way of stopping himself.

"And a large Coke."

The next hour was a blur for the lion. He wanted to cancel the order, but Evan just couldn't will himself to do it. It was as if he was being compelled to sit, wait for his food, and when it got to him, ravenously devour it. The lion felt like he was watching himself suck down burrito after burrito, pour bowls of rice down his throat, and chugging loads of soda. Other furs in the restaurant looked on in repulsion as the lion feasted, beans and cheese starting to cling to the fur around his mouth.

Only when all of the food was gone did Evan feel like himself again. The lion didn't know what came over him. But he felt embarrasses about making a scene. Quickly bussing his table, he rushed out of the restaurant, his belly feeling ready to explode at any moment.

Hours later, Evan was still resting on the couch of his apartment. While his stomach was no longer in such pain, he did feel very full. A rumble sounded from his stomach, and moments later pressure was relieved from his rump.

"God, why did I have some many bean burritos..." he said fanning a paw by his nose. The lion got up to get himself a glass of water from the kitchen. Sitting by the garbage can was the empty Purgatory Pizza box from the night before.

"Pizza sounds good! I should totally get a pizza!"

The lion was startled by the intrusive thought. He didn't want pizza! He was still full from all that Mexican food!

"Pepperoni and triple cheese! That's hit the spot!"

No! Evan felt that he had to restrain himself. But a voice deep inside of him was compelling him. The lion was so full! But...pizza did sound good...
14131.title: An Inner Demon

14132.content:
Light poured in from the hallway and illuminated the dim room lit only by a couple of bare red light bulbs. The mink sauntered in, chuckling to herself when she saw Evan in a crumpled heap on top of the wide bed, naked sans a thick metal collar chained to a nearby bolt in the concrete wall, his body frail and weak. Silk and satin bedsheets were lying on the floor. The lion's eyes were glazed over as he slowly panted. The lion was still feeling sore; the previous Client had been pretty rough with his rear.

As Lust approached Evan, the lion felt vitriol and hatred boil up inside him. He wanted to take a swing at her but knew that any harm to her would be dealt tenfold to him. That was a lesson he learned quickly.

The lion remembered first meeting the mink in the park those months ago. He remembered the offer. He remembered the refusal. He remembered the struggle, then the fight, then the hulking gorilla appearing seemingly out of thin air to manhandle Evan. He remembered first waking up in the room that he hasn't left since.

She sat down on the edge of the bed, cupping Evan's cheek and cooing. "Aww, poor baby. Tuckered out?" He said nothing. "Don't worry. You have just one more Client today, and then you can rest up!" The lion remained silent. "And I think you'll like him!"

Lust excitedly got up and went to the door. She peaked her head into the hallway and shouted "He's ready, Derrick!"

Evan glanced up as he saw an enormous German Shepard waddle into his room. The dog was so massive that he needed to turn sideways to get through the door frame. Well on his way to a half ton, the dog's t-shirt and sweatpants look panted on to his blubbery frame.

"Alright, well, you two have fun!" Lust said, patting the dog on his pudgy arm. "And feel free to be less than gentle. I heard he likes a little pain!"

She shut the door behind her, leaving Evan and the big dog alone who was licking his chops as he eyed the lion's thin body. The dog reached a paw down the front of his sweatpants and the other began pulling them down from the back.

"Cute butt," he said, smirking while approaching the bed.

The chains clinked against themselves as Evan dutifully presented himself to the Client. He felt the dog's huge belly rest on his lower back as the Client pulled Evan's hips back towards his pelvis.

As the lion's butt cheeks were parted like they were many times before, Evan reflected on that fateful night. Was the offer really that bad?
14132.title: Glutton for Punishment

choices: Take the cheetah back to the apartment
142.content:
The lion had to stop and sit down on the first bench that he saw when he got to the park. Stabbing pains pierced Evan's stomach as it ached and groaned while struggling to digest his oversized meal. He hadn't made it that far into the park itself; his apartment building could still be seen in the distance. Placing a paw on his swollen and distended belly that was pressing tight against his shirt, Evan took a few slow, deep breathe to alleviate the pain.

After a short break, the lion felt ready to continue. He then heard an unusual noise of in the distance. It sounded both rhythmic and distraught, and it was coming closer. Moments later, Evan recognized the noise as heavy panting. And when he saw the fur slowly jogging around the bend of the park's concrete path, the lion understood why.

The cheetah huffed and puffed as his flabby belly bounced up and down. Each heavy step sent shockwaves through the fur's immense and soft body. The grey sweatshirt and sweatpants he wore clung to his obese frame, the former of which was starting to rise up, exposing distorted black and orange spots of the cheetah's fur. His stride was quite small as his blubbery thighs fought to pass by one another. Loud swishing sounds made it evident how tight his legs were rubbing against each other.

The cheetah didn't notice Evan watch as he jogged along the path at a snail's pace. Sweat poured down the cheetah's plump cheeks and rolled down his chins. He didn't acknowledge Evan as he slowly jogged by the lion who was now mesmerised by this spectcle. The cheetah seemed focused on his mission. Evan saw the big cat's big backside after he waddled by, the sweatpants straining to contain the masses of cellulite. A long orange and black spotted tail hung lazily over the cheetahs ballooned up butt.

The cheetah was nearly out of sight when Evan saw him suddenly tumble to the ground with a loud "OH SHI-". The lion got up and quickly walked over to the big cat trying not to jostle around his stomach too much. Lying on the ground clutching his ankle, the cheetah moaned in pain. The left leg of his sweatpants had spit open due to the fall and the cat's pillowy thigh swelled up out of it. The area was particularly dark and not lit very well due to the many tall and shady trees nearby. Evan surmised that the cheetah had tripped over one of the several roots that had started to overtake the path.

"Hey, man! Are you okay?" Evan asked.

The cheetah once again groaned in pain. "No, my ankle is killing me!" He rubbed a meaty paw along the joint as best as he could. The cat's colossal belly made reaching it a bit difficult.

"Did you break your ankle?"

"Maybe? I don't know. It just hurts really bad! I might have just strained it, but I'm not sure!"

Evan wasn't sure what to do. If the cheetah indeed broke his ankle, then he definitely needed to call an ambulance. But the big cat's ankle didn't look broken. It might just be a bad strain. If that was the case, then Evan could try and take him the cat back to his apartment and ice his ankle.
142.title: Not exactly the fastest cat

1421.content:
Thankfully, the paramedics who came were fairly burly furs. While they still each had sizeable guts, both were heavily muscled no doubt thanks to lifting the gargantuan furs of Port Zaftig. They helped the cheetah get on to the reinforced stretcher which still groaned under his weight. The paramedics loaded the cheetah into the back and collected some contact information from Evan. Lights and sirens blaring, the ambulance drove off.

That was enough excitement for the day, so the lion headed back home, his walked have been substantially shortened. Nevertheless, it had done its job. Although bloated, the lion was no longer as painfully full as he was some time ago. Back at his apartment, the lion yanked off all his clothes and hopped into bed drifting off to sleep minutes later.

***

Evan's phone buzzed on the nightstand as a digital tune rang out. The lion picked up the phone. It was from a number he didn't recognize. Checking the time, he saw that it was early in the afternoon. The massive pizza and the long road trip into town must have really done a number on him; he needed the rest. Curious, the lion swiped across the phone's screen to accept the call.

"H-hello?"

"Yes, hello! Is this...urm...Evan?" The voice on the other side of the line said.

"Yes it is. Who is this?"

"This is Alexander Pettingham!"

"Umm...I don't know an Alexander..."

"We met la-...Oh, I don't think I introduced myself! I was the fur you called the ambulance for last night. In the park?"

"Oh, oh! Yeah, I don't think I got your name."

"Well, now you have it! I got your phone number from one of the paramedics and I wanted to call and thank you! If you weren't there, I'd probably still be on the ground now!"

"Hey, it's no problem. How's the ankle?"

"Great! Well, actually not great. The doctors said it's fractured in a couple of areas. I'll have to rest it for a couple of months so it can heal."

"Yikes. I'm glad I called the hospital then."

"And I'm glad too! Look, are you free this evening? I'd love for you to come over to my home for dinner! As a thank you!"

"Oh, there's no need. I'm just glad you're doing better."

"Nonsense! I insist! It's the least I could do! Now please, give me your address. I'll send a car over this evening..."
1421.title: A Gracious Cheetah

14211.content:
"This...can't be the place..."

The driver turned and pulled up to a long, circular driveway in front of luxurious home overseeing the beaches of Port Zaftig from an above cliff with a long patio that extended over the edge of the rockface. Palm trees and exotic plants decorated the front of the property making it appear like a venerable jungle. The car stopped in front of a pair of wide mahogany doors.

"Here you are, sir," the driver mumbled. The lion thanked him and stepped out of the car. Evan approached the front door and, before he could knock, both doors swung open revealing a spacious and warm entryway decorated with ornate paintings and thick, lush carpet. Sitting inside on an electric wheelchair was the cheetah who was wearing a silky red robe that mostly hung open exposing roll after roll of plump fat and distorted spots on his fur. His injured ankle was propped up and wrapped in bandages.

"Evan! I'm glad you made it!" Alexander said as he pushed a stick forward on the chair's arm. The wheelchair slowly lurched forward. A electric wheezing was heard as the chair struggled to carry the obese fur.

"Yeah, thanks for having me over," Evan replied. "Is...is this your place?"

"Yep! All mine!" the cheetah replied. "Paid for it myself! You won't believe how much money you can make on the stocks if you know how to play your cards right."

"Wow, this place looks amazing!" The lion looked around taking in the ostentatious abode. "Wait, if you live here, why were you jogging all the way on the other side of town?"

"There aren't many places to jog around here. Besides, I wanted to get out and see the town a bit. It's boring being up here all day. That, and I didn't want the neighbors seeing me sweating my butt off!"

"I see, but why were you out joggin-" Evan was cut off by a soft chiming noise off in the distance.

"Ah! Dinner's ready! Follow me!" The lion followed behind the cheetah in his wheelchair as the poor machine whined while it pulled the fat cat through the house. Alexander lead Evan to the patio where a large spread had been laid out. Roast, potatoes, carrots, corn, buttery roll and the works were stemming away waiting to be eaten. Evan's mouth watered as he got closer to the food. The cheetah drove his wheelchair up to one of the edge of the table, gesturing for Evan to take a seat next to him.

For the next hour and a half, the two furs quietly devoured the food laid out for them as the sun disappeared below the horizon. While the cheetah was swallowing down food at a much faster rate than Evan, the lion was keeping up a decent pace. At one point, Evan had to stealthily unbutton his pants to let his swollen belly free. But nevertheless, he was enjoying himself. The food was extremely tasty, easily one of the tastiest meals he ever had.

The cheetah was dabbing up the last of some sauce with a bread roll as Evan sat panting in his chair. Everything was now in their bellies, though Alexander kept happily munching away on the remains. If Evan was stuffed last night, he now felt like he was ready to explode. The taunt curve that was now his belly forced his shirt to ride up, exposing a couple of inches of off-white fur.

The cheetah popped the last of the roll I to his mouth. "Ready for dessert?"

Evan groaned in response. "Ugh... I'll have to pass...I feel like I'm ready to pop!"

"Yeah, you don't look so hot," Alexander said as Evan rubbing his gut. "Hey, if you'd like, you can sleep all that off here! I've got a guest bedroom!"

"Oh, oh that's too kind..." moaned Evan. "But I probably should be heading home..."

"Oh come! You're in no state to be heading home! Please, stay! It won't be any trouble on my part!"
14211.title: Feasting with Alexander

142111.content:
"Once again, thank you for having dinner with Mister Alexander. He spends so much time up here by himself. I don't he has too many friends these days. So it's nice he's socializing. Too bad he had to take a trip to the hospital for that to happen. But still..."

Evan walked behind Miss Maple, one of Alexander's servants, down the hall as she showed the lion to the bedroom he'd be staying in. Following the portly panda through the halls, Evan clutched his overstuffed belly trying not to jostle it around too much.

"Here we are!" Miss Maple said as she opened a pair of double doors. The two stepped inside and she turned on the lights. The bedroom was enormous, easily the size of Evan's entire apartment. The whole eastern wall was made of glass and faced out over the ocean. Opposite to it was a wall with many large dressers against it, and bookcases lined the rest of the walls. In the center of the room was an equally enormous bed. Judging just by looks, Evan guesses that he could more than easily spread out his arms and legs and still would have plenty of room in the bed.

"I assume you didn't bring any nightwear with you?" asked Miss Maple. Evan shook his head. "No problem. I'm sure one of Mister Alexander's pajamas are around here somewhere..." While Evan took in the bedroom, the panda servant searched through the drawers. After a minute of searching, she pulled out from an open drawer two vast swaths of red silky garments.

"Here! Found them!" she said. Miss Maple unfolded one of them, the shirt, and held it up. It was obviously several times too large for Evan. "Oh dear, I think this is a little big..."

"Don't worry, I think it'll work," replied Evan. Miss Maple left him and the lion changed into the silk pajamas. They looked like a tent on the lion, the shirt went down to his knees and he needed to hold up the pants with a paw as he shuffled over to the light switch. As he collapsed in bed, the rich silk rubbed against his fur. The lion purred in delight. The sensation of the smooth silk against the tight skin of his belly was amazing, and within minutes Evan was fast asleep.

Several hours later, the lion woke up. It was still very dark in the bedroom, but he couldn't help but notice that sitting on the nightstand was a large chocolate cake. It was, no doubt, the dessert he skipped out on, and one of the servants must have dropped it off while he slept.

Evan picked off a bit of the icing with his paw and tasted it. It was smooth and rich and very, very chocolatey. Next to the cake was a knife, fork, and plate. Though the lion was still somewhat full, his stomach had deflated enough to the point that he felt he could eat a slice or two. Or three.

Yet right when he was about to cut into the cake, Evan heard a loud crashing sound from down the hallway. It noise startled the lion. At first, he thought about checking it out. After all, someone might be in trouble. But the house was pretty big and Evan didn't want to get lost or go somewhere where he shouldn't be.
142111.title: Midnight Delight

choices: Make him stick to his diet
1422.content:
Evan's couch groaned as the cheetah, with the lion's help, lowered his heavy body onto it. The big cat's ripped sweatpants laid on the floor leaving his chunky thighs exposed, though his pudgy rump was still covered by a pair of incredibly large black breifs. The two masses, looking like a couple of cottage cheese filled pillow cases, spread out as the cheetah sat down. The fat fur huffed and puffed, still exhausted from his run and his journey to the Evan's apartment. He heaved his huge body over to lay down and rested his injured ankle ont the arm of the couch.

Resting a paw on his still full gut, the lion made his way to the fridge to create a makeshift ice pack for the cheetah. "Do you think it's broken?" he asked, placing the ice pack on the cheetah's thick ankle.

"No, no. I think I just sprained it," he replied. "God, what a bad way to start a diet."

"I'll say. It'll be at least a week before you can go out jogging again," Evan said.

"Ugh. Just another week for me to sit on my fat butt and keep ballooning up..." the cheetah moaned. "Maybe I should just get my jaw wired shut. Then I won't be able to stuff my face all the time."

"Don't be so down! You'll heal up soon and be ready to shed some pounds again!" Evan gave the cheetah's plump thigh a pat, sending ripples through the fat. "Name's Evan, by the way."

"Alexander. Thanks for helping me out," he replied.

"Hey, no problem! Least I could!"

The cheetah glanced over to the coffee table where the empty pizza box sat. "Oh...I haven't had pizza in days. I don't have my phone on me. Do you think you could, um, order me one?"

Evan shot the cheetah a confused look. "Aren't you supposed to be on a diet?"

"Yeah. But come on! It'll make me feel better!"
1422.title: A Cheetah in Need

choices: Pass on getting that big again
144.content:
The lion closed the apartment door behind him and he set a bag down on the kitchen counter. While the store on his street corner mostly sold junk food and the like, he did find a box of antacid tablet that ought to soothe his aching stomach. And, since Evan was quite parched from the pizza, purchased a bottle of lemon-lime flavored soda. However, the only bottles they had massive 3L bottles.

"Umm, do you have anything smaller?" Evan asked the obese rhino behind the counter. He only grunted in response, his eyes not leaving the small television next to the register.

Unfortunately, the lion realized that while the apartment came with a lot of furniture, it didn't come with anything in the way of cups or glasses. Nor did Evan pack any with him. This left him in a bit of a pickle since the antacid tablets needed to be dissolved in liquid to work.

Fortunately, he had a substitute.

Placing the large soda bottle his coffee table, Evan unscrewed the top. He then broke up a few of the tablets to fit past the bottles neck. Dropping the tablet fragments in, they started to bubble and fizz, added even more bubbles to the already bubbly soda.

Evan sat down on the couch and grabbed the bottle with both paws. He raised it to his mouth and started drinking. Almost immediately the dissolved tablets has a positive effect on the lion's belly. Gone were the stabbing pains of being excessively full. As he continued drinking, all the pain simply vanished. On top of that, the soda was exceptional delicious, easily the most delicious soda he ever drank. The lion felt compelled to take drink after drink, wanting to taste even more of that tasty liquid.

It wasn't until the bottle was empty that Evan realized that he somehow sucked down the whole bottle. He originally planned only to drink some of it. Now, all three liters of soda we're churning away in his belly which was now a cream furred sphere nearly the size of a small beach ball. Evan was shocked at how big his gut was. Sure, he had been full before, but he looked enormous. The lion pulled off his shirt and rubbed a paw along the taught skin of his belly that was taking up a considerable amount of his lap. It didn't hurt touching the bloated sphere. It was just bizarre to Evan that it was all him. Groans and creaks sounded from the lion's belly as he continued to gently rub the mass. Thinking that he ought to lay down, Evan tried picking himself up off from the couch. Yet the sheer weigh in his belly pulled him right back down as his gut wobbled and the contents inside slushed around.

"Well, I guess I'm stuck here for a while," Evan said while chuckling.

The lion was finally able to get off the couch hours later after an evening and burping and deflating. By the next morning, his stomach had resumed its typically flat state. Evan was still amazed how big his stomach got. It looked like someone pumped him up like a balloon. The lion then became curious if he could do it again, to see if he could swell up his belly just as big. But then again, he didn't want to end up with a painfully bloated belly either.
144.title: Body by bloating

Evan hoped at least some of his new neighbors were in. It was still late in the morning, and if any of them worked day jobs then they would probably be gone. But the lion figured that it wouldn't hurt to see if any were around.

Because of the sheer enormity of the apartments, the seventh floor didn't have as many units as most buildings would have. Out of 706 came a young, full-figured lioness. Approximately 250 pounds, she carried most of her weight in his thighs and butt, both of which were terribly straining her pants. She looked flustered as her paw dug into her backpack. Pulling out a set of keys, she quickly looked the door to the apartment and turned to briskley walk to the elevator, seemingly ignoring Evan.

On the third time knocking, Evan reasoned that whoever lived in Unit 701 wasn't in right now. This didn't bother the lion. He was sure he'd eventually meet everyone who lived on the floor.

He glanced down to see three boxes stacked up next to the door. Evan didn't recalled seeing them this morning when he was moving in; they must have been delivered recent. All three of the boxes were small, and each looked beaten and battered: Corners crushed in, address labels torn, cardboard flaps hanging loosely.

All three of them were addressed from the same location:

EPISTEME LABS - ZAFTIG CITY DIVISION

4597 FOOL'S GOLD AVE.
ZAFTIG CITY 97212

And all three were addressed to the same fur: Daniel Taffington. At least now Evan knew the name of who lived here.

The lion was about to head back to his apartment when he thought about those boxes again. They looked to be rough shape, and they were just sitting there in plain sight. Perhaps Evan should be a good neighbor and take them home. He can give them to Daniel when he came back home and explain the situation. Evan was sure Daniel would appreciate the gesture.
151.title: A good deed?

1511.content:
Much of the rest of the day for Evan was spent unpacking the remainder of his belongings. It was well into the evening when everything was in its proper place. Everything, that is, except for the three small packages sitting on his kitchen counter.

Seeing how beaten up and battered the packages were, Evan thought he'd be doing whoever lived in 701 a favor by holding on to them until they got home to make sure they didn't get damaged even more. Periodically throughout the day, Evan peeked his head out into the hallway to see if the resident of 701 had made it home yet. Not once did Evan hear any fur make their way down that part of the long hallway or interact with the door.

One final time for the night, Evan looked out into the hallway in the direction of 701. This time, however, the door was ajar. The lion grabbed the three boxes and made his way to the unit. Knocking on the door, it swung open slightly. No lights were on inside.

"Hello? Uh, Daniel? I've got some packages for you!" Evan hollered into the apartment. No response came. He felt around for a switch by the door and found one. He flicked it, illuminating the apartment. The unit was mostly empty. Evan slowly stepped inside to investigate. Nothing was there. No furniture, no dishes, nothing left in the cupboards. The only things that were left were some trash scattered on the floor and a few sheet of notebook paper with illegible writing scrawled on it.

Convinced that the apartment had been abandoned, Evan returned to his own. Setting the packages back into the counter, he looked at them and pondered what to do next. They all came from Episteme Labs, specifically the Zaftig City branch. They might have a division here in Port Zaftig. If so, Evan could drop them off there and they'd certainly be in safe hands. But the lion was also curious what the packages held. The boxes looked pretty rough and it wouldn't take much to open them up and peek inside. And why not? If whoever lived in 701 didn't bother to stick around for them, what would be the problem with Evan checking what's inside?
1511.title: Vacancy?

15112.content:
Styrofoam and cardboard laid stern about on Evan's kitchen counter. Inside each of the three containers were vials made of thick, heavy plastic and sealed shut with a cap. They were obviously designed to not shatter during their transportation. But there wasn't any sort of warnings or labels or anything on the vials. The lion had them laid out on the counter. Each had a luminescent, thin liquid inside of them. One of the vials held a bright blue liquid, another had a dark yellow like fluid, and the last was a vibrant green.

Evan was curious about these vials. Where these things dangerous? They couldn't be, the lion reasoned. If so, why were they sent through the regular mail? And why would anybody be so careless as to let them just sit outside the door to someone's apartment? Clearly, they couldn't be that hazardous. The lion thought it might be stupid, but his curiosity was getting the better of him. Why not take a swig of one of these? It couldn't be that bad, could it?
15112.title: Three vials

151121.content:
Evan came to on the cold bathroom floor, his arms clutching the base of the toilet. He saw the empty vial on the floor and remembered drinking the entire blue contents then becoming violently ill. Rushing to the toilet, the lion tried making himself throw up to get rid of what was poisoning him, but he soon blacked out.

The lion had no idea how long he had been lying on the floor. However, he did feel much more better now. Grabbing the vial, he threw it against one of the wall while quietly swearing. As Evan picked himself off the ground, he noticed that his fur, typically a golden hue, was now a shade of blue. He panicked as he got up and looked at himself in the bathroom mirror. All of his fur now was some shade of blue. His arms, legs, face, chest, even his belly was a hue of blue.

"My...belly?"

This was the other major change to Evan's body. Typically flat as a board, his stomach had swollen up massively. His gut now stuck out over a foot and a half in front of him, blocking his view of his own feet. The lion's shirt was too small to cover it all up and was now ridding up around his chest. Were the lion able to see, he could find that at some point the button of his pants exploded off, allowing his belly to sink down a few inches.

He starred in astonishment. Evan picked up the mass with both paws, lifting it up before letting it go. It wobbled and bounced around. The lion swore he heard the distinct sound of sloshing. Evan didn't feel full or anything, so he wasn't sure what exactly was making that noise. The lion continues to jostle and prod his belly, as if testing to see if it was real. It was real.

Evan was spooked. That liquid had done something to him, and he needed to reverse that, if it could be reversed. Worst of all, the lion wasn't sure this was the end. He hoped nothing else would happen to him, but Evan couldn't take that chance. Maybe now was the right time to reach out to Episteme Labs. They might know what he drank and they could have something to change him back. Or, he could break into Unit 701 again. Sure, it was empty the last time Evan went in. But maybe he could find a clue as to what was in that vial.
151121.title: Evan blues up

choices: Go with Daniel to his lab
Demand to know more about this "incident"
1511212.content:
slosh slosh slosh

The liquid inside Evan sloshed around as the now blue lion searched through the abandoned Unit 701 for clues, any clues, about the fluid he stupidly decided to drink. The bedroom was empty sans an old discarded sock in a corner of the room. The bathroom, too, held nothing useful. The kitchen didn't have anything for him to work with. And the living room held nothing either.

Evan was distraught. He needed to find something quick, something that could change him back, shrink down his belly, un-blue him.

Just then, the lion felt a sharp stabbing pain in his gut. He grabbed at his ballooned up belly as Evan doubled over in pain. It felt as if many sharp knives were slicing the skin of his stomach. Dropping to his hands and knees, he roared in pain hoping that maybe one of the other tenets will hear him. The sharp slicing pains were soon accompanied by a suddenly feeling of intense fullness as if the lion just got done devouring a large feast. Tears formed in the lion's eyes as he felt his belly expand even bigger, drooping lower and lower until the nearly reached the floor. Evan shook in agony and he could hear more sloshing from inside him. He felt his furry belly brush against the cold hardwood floor of the living room. Then, just as rapidly as it had arrived, the pain left Evan and his belly stopped expanding.

Collapsing onto the floor, the lion panted and groaned as he gently rubbed a paw against his expanded middle. His blue gut had the consistency of a water balloon, bouncing and wobbling as he pressed his paw into it. This wasn't fat, he reasoned. It was something...else.

Evan tried to get back onto his feet. But the new weight in his midsection along with the sheer exhaustion from that painful episode made it impossible for him to move. Instead, the lion found himself fading in and out of consciousness lying on the floor until his eyes finally shut.

***

"Hey! Hey! Wake up!"

Evan's eyes slowly opened as they adjusted to the sunlight that was now pouring in from the living room windows. Rubbing the sleep from his eyes, he saw standing over him was a fur. An otter, young looking with dark brown fur. The fur was extremely skinny, however, the clothes he was wearing looked like a tent on him. His white shirt went down nearly to his knees and he was holding up his baggy pants with one of his paws.

"Hey! Are you alive?" he asked.

"Yeah...yeah I am," Evan said groggily. "Who are you?"

"Who am I? That's what should be asking you! And what are you doing here?"

"I'm Evan. And, uh, I found some packages outside of this place and..." Evan bashfully patted a paw on his blue furred belly. A small shockwave rippled through it. "The next thing I know I'm blue all over! And growing! I didn't have this belly yesterday! And it's only getting bigger! And I'm blue! My fur isn't supposed to be blue!"

"Oh, oh no..." the otter said. "Please don't tell me you... those needed to be...I knew I should have...Did you drink all of them?"

"No, just the blue one."

The otter sighed a little bit. "Okay, okay, so it's not that bad. Still bad, but not as bad as it could have been."

"Bad? What the hell did I drink?" Evan asked.

"I...don't know," the otter replied. "A colleague of mine, a botanist, wanted me to run tests on some samples. They were all specimens she and her expedition discovered deep in some jungles half a world away. She sent them here through the regular mail so they wouldn't raise any suspicions. But there was an...incident...at my workplace. At Episteme Labs." He sheepishly tugged on his oversized shirt. "I had to leave here in a hurry. But I forgot about the specimens so I came back here to collect them."

"This is your apartment?" asked Evan. "I take it you're Daniel?"

"Yes, that's me." The otter knelt down and placed a paw on Evan's belly. "And you said you've been getting...bigger?"

"Yeah, I passed out some time ago. My gut got bigger and it hurt like hell. I just ended up passing out afterwards."

"What were you doing here anyways?" The otter asked.

"I didn't know what was happening! I figured that there might be something here to tell me what's happening to me!"

The otter sighed again. "Well, there isn't. Look, we've got to get you out of here. I've got a set-up across town in a studio apartment that nobody should bother me or you in. I can try and run some tests there, figure out what you drank and if there's a way to change you back."

While Evan was desperate for help, he wasn't going to get it from just anyone. Daniel said something about an "incident" at a lab. If he was a bad researcher, the otter could do more harm than good to the lion. However, getting answers from him might take too much time. And Evan wasn't sure how long he had left before he got too big, or worse.
1511212.title: The Doctor is In

choices: Wait around for something to happen
15112121.content:
Surrounded by loads of machines that he didn't recognize, Evan sat clad only in a pair of white briefs in the studio apartment that Daniel had converted into a makeshift lab. His swollen, blue-furred belly rested on his lap sloshing around at the slightest movement. The otter had done a number of tests on the lion, but he wasn't finding anything that could tell them exactly what was happening to Evan and how they could possibly stop it, let alone reverse it.

The lion watched as Daniel sat at a microscope examining a blood sample taken from Evan. The otter, too, was only dressed in his underwear, a pair of loose boxers that looked a couple of sizes too big for him yet still were small enough to cling to his narrow hips. The possible problem with that idea is that if we trigger your...uh, inflation, then we might not be able to stop it. I mean, we have no evidence to conclude that you won't stop getting bigger, but that's just a risk we have to take into consideration."

Jessie wiped off the beads of sweat that were accumulating on his forehead. It was finally starting to get warm out. But luckily for the red panda, all of the yardwork was done for the day. The hedges were trimmed, the flowerbeds were free of weeds, and the lawn was mowed. He was never a fan of yard work. Yet in a small town like Peevington, jobs were hard to come by and he had to pay rent somehow. And he certainly got paid well.

Rolling the lawn mower into the backyard, he pushed it back into the gardening shed, locking it away. More sweat was forming, and the thin fur pulled up the bottom of his tank top to dry his forehead, exposing his flat stomach to the warm air.

"Lawn's looking good!"

On the back deck of the house was Daniel. Jessie had been working for him for nearly a year now. The otter was nice enough, even if he was a bit of a recluse. Most of the time, he stayed in his home. The red panda didn't blame him. He moved here from Port Zaftig, and small town folk can be pretty mean to city dwellers. And the fact that Daniel was comically overweight gave them extra ammunition. Jessie guesses he must be three quarters of a ton. His gigantic belly stuck out several feet and drooped down past his knees. The otter's chest sported moobs as big as Jessie's head.
